"You're the one with regrets, aren't you, Nee-san?! You got engaged, right?! Even though you knew it was a fate that would never be fulfilled!!"

「うん。…ずっとずっと、永遠に一緒だよって、約束した。
"Yes. I promised that we would always, always be together, for eternity.

……だからね？　その瞬間に、……私たちの永遠は、完成したの。例え、私たちが生贄になってしまうとしても、もう、完成してるの。だから、いいの。」
...So you know what? ...In that instant, our eternity was completed. Even if we become sacrifices, it's already completed. So, it's okay."

「………未練があるのはむしろ嘉音くんの方。…私たちは家具なんでしょ？　私たちはどういう結果になろうとも解放される。…なら、黄金郷に行けるか行けないかなんて、どうでもいいことじゃない。……なのに嘉音くんは黄金郷へ行くことに固執してる。………どうしても人間になりたいんでしょ？　…どうして？」
"......Kanon, you're the one who actually has regrets. ...We're furniture, right? We'll be freed no matter the result. ...So, it doesn't matter whether we go to Golden Land or not. ...And yet you're set on going there. ......You want to become human no matter what, right? ...Why?"

「人間になりたいからだよッ！！　家具はもう嫌だ！！」
"Because I want to become human!! I've had enough of being furniture!!"

「どうして？」
"Why?"

「僕も、恋がしたかったんだッ…！！！」
"I...wanted to fall in love too...!!!"

嘉音の両目から涙が零れる。
…そして吼える。
Tears were coming from Kanon's eyes.

...And he howled.

「……お嬢様のことが、好きだった…！！　そしてあの日のお嬢様の姿を見て、もっと好きになった…！　そしてお嬢様も僕のことが好きだとわかって、すごく嬉しかった…！！　でも僕は家具で、……お嬢様の気持ちを受け止めることはできなくてッ！！」
"...I...liked Milady...!! And after seeing Milady that day, I started liking her even more...! And when I heard that Milady also liked me, I was really happy...!! But I'm furniture, ...and I can't accept Milady's feelings!!"

「…それが勘違いだった。………私たちは家具かもしれない。人間以下かもしれない。…でも、恋をする資格がないわけじゃなかった。」
"...You're wrong. ......We may be furniture. We may be less than human. ...But that doesn't mean that we aren't qualified to love."

「添い遂げられぬ思いなら、ない方がましだって思った！！　いつか自分も消え去る日が来て、それがきっとお嬢様を傷つけるなんて勝手に決め付けて、………違うんだッ！！　僕が怯えていただけなんだ！！　僕は、……永遠になれない恋なら、しない方がましだって、怯えてただけなんだッ！！」
"I thought that...if these feelings wouldn't ever come to anything, I'd be better off not having them!! I just decided that eventually, I'd disappear, and that it'd definitely hurt her. ......No, that's wrong!! I was just frightened!! I...was just afraid, thinking that any love that couldn't be eternal was best avoided!!"

「……蝉は、生涯の内、数週間にも満たないわずかな期間で恋をして、消えていくんだって。………数週間で終わる恋だからと、恋をしない蝉はいないんじゃないかな。」
"...Even though their lives last only a few weeks, cicadas fall in love and then vanish. ......But you'll never find a cicada that refused to fall in love simply because it'd end in a few weeks."

「ううぅうううぅううぅ！！　うっうぅうううぅうぅうぅぅ！！」
"Aaaaaaaaaaaaagggghhh!! Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaggghhh!!"

嘉音はまだ未練を口にしていたようだけれど、もう泣き声でごっちゃになってしまっていた…。
It seemed that Kanon was still muttering his regrets, but by now, it was all jumbled up with his sobs...

「……あの魔女が憎い…！！　僕に、…どうしてこんな気持ちを植えつけて…！　あいつさえ、あいつさえ妙な悪戯をしなければ、僕はお嬢様のことなんか、気にならなかったのに…！！！」
"...That witch is detestable...!! ...Why did she plant these feelings in me...?! If only...if only she hadn't pulled that bizarre prank, I wouldn't have paid Milady any notice...!!!"

「…………ベアトリーチェさまは酷いね。…嘉音くんに、そうやって悔し泣きをさせるために、運命を悪戯した。
".........Beatrice-sama is detestable. ...To make you cry bitter tears, she played games with your fate.

………でも、魔女の思惑は多分、外れてる。…だって、」
......But I don't think things went as the witch expected. ...After all-"

恋を知ることは生への未練ではなく。
それこそが私たちの生きる旅の、辿り着くべきところなんだもの…。
Knowing love isn't a regret that ties you to life.

It is the destination we're supposed to reach in our journey through life...

というわけだ、嘉音。
せっかくの約束はこれで水泡だな。
くっくくくくくくくくくく！
Well now, Kanon.

That promise you worked so hard for has now come to nothing.

*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*!

さてさて。
これにて全ての駒の条件は同じよ。
Very well then.

With this, the conditions for all of the pieces are the same.

駒は１８！　１３人が生贄に捧げられる！
生き残る５人は誰か？
There are 18 pieces! 13 will be offered as sacrifices!

Who will the five survivors be?

…………それとも。
誰かがこの儀式を打ち壊してみせるか？
誰が！！　どうやって？！
......Or else...

Will someone destroy this ceremony?

Who?!! How?!

ふっははははははっはははははははははははは！！
Fuhahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha!!

これはチェスプロブレムではない。
対等なゲームだ。
This isn't a chess problem.

It's a game on an equal footing.

妾だけが一方的に詰めるわけではない。
そなたは妾の詰めから懸命に逃れ続け、引き分け無効試合に持ち込むことができる。
I won't be cornering you one-sidedly.

You'll be able to frantically escape my advances and force a tie, an invalid match.

まぁ、せいぜいそなたにできるのはそれを延々と繰り返すのが関の山よ。
そしておそらく、それはそなたにとってそう難しいことではあるまい。
At any rate, I doubt you can manage more than repeating that over and over.

And it probably won't be that difficult for you.

しかし、そなたは永遠に続く無効試合に、やがて精神をすり減らし、やがては精神を殺す。
However, this invalid match will continue forever...until it eventually wears down your mind and kills it.

その時にこそ、敗北を受け入れ妾に屈服することになるであろう！！
That is when you'll accept your defeat and surrender to me!!

対等なゲームと言った理由。
There's a reason I said it was a game on an equal footing.

……それは、妾にも敗北の条件を設けてあることだ。
負けのないゲームほど退屈なものはないのでな？
...That's because rules for my loss have also been established.

There's nothing as boring as a game you can't lose, right?

妾を負かす方法。
それは、妾の肖像画に捧げられたあの碑文よ。
As for how to defeat me...

That would be...the epitaph that stands as an offering to my portrait.

あれこそは黄金郷の扉の開き方にして同時に儀式を打ち破る鍵でもある。
It's both the way to open the door to the Golden Land...and the key to destroying my ceremony.

妾は碑文に従い儀式を完遂する。
そなたは碑文の謎を解き、儀式を打ち破り妾を滅ぼす…！
I'll try to complete the ceremony in accordance with the epitaph.

You'll try to solve the riddle of the epitaph, destroy the ceremony and overthrow me...!

碑文に隠された謎を解き、妾が金蔵に与えし莫大なる黄金の在り処を暴いて見せよ！！
Solve the riddle hidden in the epitaph, and expose the location of the vast sum of gold I gave Kinzo!!

此度のゲームはどういう結末を見せるのやら！
健闘を期待するぞ？
What result will this game show us?!

I'm expecting a good fight, okay?

妾を楽しませてみせろよ、右代宮戦人あああああぁぁッ！！
Entertain me, Ushiromiya Battleeeeeeeeeeeeeer!!

「……………………………。」
".................."

「……………異論はない。…私と夏妃は認める。」

"......Ggh... ...I can't believe it, ...and I don't want to, ...but this is...the truth, isn't it..."

「…夏妃。言葉を少し選びなさい。………彼女は当家の最高の賓客なのだ。」
"...Natsuhi, choose your words more carefully. ......She's this family's most honored guest."

「…………わ、わしらも認める。…ぐぅの音も出ぇへん。」

"Yes. ...I acknowledge it. ......I have absolutely no complaints. I can't believe you actually... ......You have my honest respect."

「私もよ…。…………すごいわ。純粋に尊敬する。……だから認めざるを得ないわ。」

"I acknowledge it too... ......I still can't believe it. ...Still, ......what can I do? ~ib~You've proven devils~ib~! It's your victory...!"

「くっくっくっくっく…！　悪魔の証明は、そなたが好む証明不能への便利な言い訳だったが、……仇になったようだな？」
"*cackle*cackle*cackle*...! The Devil's Proof was once a convenient excuse you used to deal with unprovable facts, ...but now it's become your mortal enemy, has it not?"

".................."

「………霧江。まだ異論があるか…？
"...Kyrie, do you still have objections...?

妾は全員一致しか好まぬ。お前ひとりが妾の存在を認めぬならば…、」
I must have everyone in agreement. If you alone will not acknowledge my existence..."

魔女が不敵に笑うと、兄弟たちは焦りだす。
…魔女を不快にさせることに怯えているのだ。
As the witch laughed boldly, the siblings started getting frantic.

...They were afraid of displeasing the witch.

霧江はうっすらと目を閉じ、…しばらくの間、沈黙を守ってから口を開いた。
Kyrie lightly closed her eyes, ...and after keeping silent for a while, opened her mouth.

「…ごめんなさい。……降参よ。」
"...My apologies. ...I resign."

霧江だけが、最後まで魔女に厳しい目を向けていた。
Only Kyrie had faced the witch with stern eyes until the end.

……だが、それは真実を受け容れるのをほんのわずかな時間、拒否したに過ぎない。
目の前にある現実は、存在は、何も否定できないのだ。
...However, this had only resulted in her refusing to accept the truth for a short time.

The truth...the being...that was before her eyes...couldn't be denied.

~ib~もう悪魔は証明されてしまった~ib~…！
~ib~Devils had already been proven~ib~...!

「………私も、認めるわ。……あなたはベアトリーチェ。右代宮家の顧問錬金術師。…そして、偉大なる魔法の使い手。………………魔女であることを認めざるを得ない…！」

……いつも耳を満たすのは何の音か。
雨の音か、滝の音か、それとも無線の砂嵐なのか。
...What is that sound that always fills my ears?

ならば血潮の音であってほしい。

If not, I want it to be the sound of blood flowing through my body.

...I want it to be the sound of the blood circulating throughout me, telling me that I am still alive...

「…………………む…。……朝、なのか…。」
".........Nnn... ...Is it...morning...?"

カーテンの隙間から入る光は弱々しいが、夜が明けたことだけは教えてくれた。
The light entering through a crack in the curtain was faint, but it at least told him that dawn had broken.

金蔵は、目覚めた時の姿勢のまま、…椅子に座り天上を見上げた姿勢のまま…、全身に血をゆっくりと巡らせて行く…。
Kinzo, still in the position he'd been when he woke up, ...still sitting in a chair and looking up at the ceiling, ...felt the blood slowly travel throughout his body...

…時計を見ると早朝、６時ぴったり。
……どれだけ疲れていようとも、どれだけ深く眠っていようとも、まるで砂時計で計ったかのようにぴたりとこの時間に目覚める。
...Judging by the clock, it was early morning, 6:00 on the dot.

...No matter how tired he was, no matter how deeply he slept, he always woke up at exactly this time, as though he had measured it with an hourglass.

こんなことが自慢になるとは思っていないが、その程度のことができる内は、自分はまだまだ強健なのだと自分に言い聞かせていた。
He didn't think of this as something to boast about, but he told himself that, as long as he could still manage this, his health couldn't be that bad.

「………朝を迎えた、ということは…。……………ふむ。……どうやら、最初の生贄は逃れたということらしい。……ルーレットの目が幸運だったのか、…我が努力の賜物なのか、区別の付かぬところが何とももどかしいが、それは言うまい。」
"......Morning has come, which means.........hmmm. ...It would appear I've avoided becoming one of the first sacrifices. ...Was I merely lucky when the roulette was spun, ...or is this the fruit of my efforts? How irritating that I cannot tell the difference, but I mustn't be bothered by such trivialities."

金蔵は、書斎の扉の外側を見てみたい誘惑に少しだけ駆られた。
Kinzo was struck by a faint desire to see beyond the study door.

ひょっとすると、最初の６人の生贄に自分を選ぼうとして、この扉を破ろうと悪足掻きした痕跡が見つけられるかもしれないと思ったからだ。
After all, he might find the traces of someone's vain struggle to break through the door, a sign that someone had tried to select him as one of the first six sacrifices.

「…ふ。………人間とは安っぽい生き物だな。……人事を尽くして天命を待ちながら、幸運を得られた時には、それが単なる幸運ではなく、己の技量に拠るものだったと自惚れたくもなる。」
"...Hmph. ......Humans are cheap creatures. ...Even though everything is ultimately decided by God, when humans are given good fortune, they arrogantly feel it was due to their own ability."

だから、扉に惨めな痕跡があることを確かめたい。…それが人間というものだ。
That was why he wanted to check whether there was a wretched mark on the door. ...The very desire was human.

だから、金蔵は確かめない。
人間だからしたくなることを、抑え付ける。
それによって金蔵は、自分は人間を超えた存在に至ったのだという充足感に浸れるのだ…。
And that was why Kinzo did not check.

He often rejected desires that came to him because he was human.

By doing that, he could be immersed in a feeling of sufficiency, as though he himself had become a being that surpassed humans...

人の欲を自覚し、戒める。
人のしたいことに、抗う。
He recognized human desires for what they were...and guarded against them.

Things that a human would want to do, he resisted.

……この偏屈かつ捻くれたセンスが、きっと彼に稀な博才を与え、右代宮家を一代にして復興させるという偉業を成し遂げさせたに違いない…。
...This eccentricity and rebellious nature had surely given him a rare genius, making it possible for him to succeed in his exploits as he revived the Ushiromiya family in a single generation...

「さて、ベアトリーチェ。お前が取った６つの駒は何なのか。……そして、次なる手はどうくるのか。…楽しませてもらうぞ。………私の守りは完璧だ。前回のような無様は晒さぬぞ。……ふ、……っふっふっふっふ。」
"Well then, Beatrice. What were the six pieces you took? ...And, what will your next move be? ...Entertain me. ......My defense is perfect. I will not shame myself like last time. ...Heh, ...heheheh."

使用人たちの朝は早い。
The servants woke early.

カーテンを開け、朝食の準備をし、新しい一日で客人たちを迎えるための様々な準備をしなくてはならない。
They had to open the curtains, prepare breakfast, and complete various other tasks to welcome the guests to a new day.

一番、大張り切りなのは郷田だった。
Gohda was the most enthusiastic.

親族会議の期間中は、特に料理人としての仕事に集中するように言われており、本来、使用人がこなさなければならないいくつかの仕事が特別に免除されていた。
During the family conference, he had been told to concentrate his efforts especially on cooking, and he'd been specially exempted from several tasks that servants normally must do.

…見栄っ張りな郷田は、その辺りに優越感を特に感じるらしい。
館内の準備を源次たちに任せ、厨房で朝食の準備に勤しむのだった。
...Gohda, who was a show off, seemed to be feeling particularly superior because of that.

He let Genji and the rest prepare the rest of the mansion...and worked on making breakfast in the kitchen.

源次は、紗音と嘉音の三人で手分けして、様々な準備をこなしていく。
Genji split the work with Shannon and Kanon, and they carried out various tasks.

紗音は、食堂へ向かい、ノックした。
Shannon headed to the dining hall and knocked.

…昨年は、親族会議は未明にまで及んだ。
今年の親族会議は、とうとう早朝にまで及んでも不思議はない。
...Last year, the family conference had continued into the early hours of the morning.

It wouldn't have been odd if this year's conference had done the same.

まだ中で会議が続いている可能性を考え、ノックしたのだった。
だが反応はなかったので、おはようございますと口にしながら扉を開ける。
Considering the possibility that they were still having a discussion inside, she knocked.

But there was no response, so she opened the door and said good morning.

「…おはようございます。……………いらっしゃいませんか。」
"...Good morning. ......Is anyone there?"

部屋の空気は冷たく、だいぶ前に会議は終わっていたようだった。
The room was cold, and the conference seemed to have ended a long time before.

机の上には、彼らが飲んだのだろう、お茶の道具が集められ、片付けやすいようになっていた。
There was a tea set on the table from which they'd probably been drinking, arranged in a way that would make it easy to clean up.

お茶の片付けは使用人の仕事だ。
だから、彼らが気を利かせ過ぎて片付けてしまうと、使用人の立つ瀬がなくなる。
Cleaning up the tea was a servant's job.

If the family members were extra generous and cleaned it up themselves, the servants would lose face.

だから、こうしてもらえるだけでも本当に嬉しい気遣いだった。
So, it was a truly pleasant act of kindness for the family to do only this much.

片付けようとテーブルに近付くと、メモ用紙のようなものが食器と一緒に残されているのに気が付いた。
As she approached the table to clean it, she noticed something like a memo that had been left near the utensils and cups.

お茶の道具と一緒に置かれていたので、片付けに来た使用人に対し申し送ったメモだろうと自然に思い、紗音はそれを手に取る。
Since it was right next to the tea set, Shannon picked it up, naturally thinking it was a memo for the servant doing the cleaning.

そこには、要望でもなく、お茶の準備に対する感謝でもなく、ただ一言だけが書かれていた。
Written there was not a request, nor was it thanks for preparing the tea. There was just a single word.

紗音はきょとんと、それを読み上げる…。
Shannon looked at it blankly and read it out loud...

「…………礼拝堂。……………？」
"......Chapel. ......?"

何か小さな音がずっと聞こえ続けていた。
それは本来ならば取るに足らないつまらない音。
A small sound kept repeating over and over.

Normally, that sound would've been too trivial to be worth caring about.

早く聞こえなくなればいい、そうすればまどろみに戻れるのにと、ぼんやり考えていた。
If only I could stop hearing it soon, I could go back to sleep right away, ...she thought vaguely.

…しかしいつまでも音は終わらない。
ずっとずっと繰り返されている。
...But no matter how much time passed, the sound did not end.

It repeated over and over.

あぁ、うるさい。
誰なの？　扉をずっと叩き続けているのは。
Aaah, shut up.

Who is it? Banging on the door this whole time...

それに気付いた途端、目が覚めた。
……誰かがノックしているのだ。
As soon as she realized that, she woke up.

...Someone was knocking.

気付けば、それはノックだけでなく声もだった。
Then, she noticed that it wasn't just a knock, but a voice as well.

「………楼座さま、…楼座さま。……おはようございます。」
"......Rosa-sama, ...Rosa-sama. ...Good morning."

「ま、……待って。今、行きます。」
"...W-Wait. I'm coming now."

それは源次の声だった。
時計を見ると、まだ７時にもなっていない。
It had been Genji's voice.

Looking at the clock, it wasn't even 7:00 yet.

……客人を起こすには明らかに早すぎる時間だった。…それに値する何か良くないことでもあったのだろうか。
...It was clearly too early to wake the guests. ...Did something happen that was bad enough to cause this?

その不吉な予感に、眠気がどんどん醒めてくるのを感じた。
She felt her sleepiness increasingly fade thanks to this premonition of misfortune.

楼座にとって、源次は子どもの頃から馴染みのある使用人であったため、少し無防備に寝巻き姿のまま、扉を細く開けて応じた。
Though Genji was a servant, Rosa had known him since her childhood days, so even though she was slightly defenseless in her pajamas, she opened the door a crack and answered.

「おはようございます。早朝から申し訳ございません。」
"Good morning. I apologize for waking you this early."

「……何かあったの？」
"...Did something happen?"

「はい…。………実は礼拝堂に…………、…………。」
"Yes... ......Actually, at the chapel...... ......"

源次は楼座の耳元に口を寄せ、小声で何かを伝えた。
Genji...whispered something into Rosa's ear.

楼座は、一度では何を言われているか理解できなかったらしく、何度か復唱してからようやく何かおかしなことが起きたらしいことを理解する。
For a second, it seemed Rosa couldn't understand what she'd been told. After having it repeated several times, she realized that apparently, something strange had happened.

楼座は一度扉を閉め、すぐに着替えると源次を伴い、屋敷へ向かうのだった…。
Rosa closed her door for a second, changed her clothes quickly, and followed Genji towards the mansion...

礼拝堂について、説明がいる。
これは屋敷の中にはなく、屋敷の裏からほんの少しだけ歩いた木立の中にあった。
The chapel requires some explanation.

It wasn't in the mansion, but in a grove behind it, a short walk's distance away.

六軒島に屋敷が建てられたのと同時に建立されたもので、何度か外壁の補修を行ない、外見だけは新しそうに見えながらも、かなり古い建物であった。
It had been built at the same time as the mansion, so though its walls had been repaired many times, making it look new from the outside, it was a very old building.

楼座と源次が共に雨の中を駆けていく。
雨は昨夜から変わらず本格的な降りのままだった。
Rosa dashed through the rain along with Genji.

Just like the previous night, the rain was falling in earnest.

やがて、薄い木立の向こうに礼拝堂が見えてくる…。
Eventually, the chapel came into sight from beyond a thin grove...

外観を見るだけだったなら、若い恋人たちが挙式をしてみたくなるような、美しく清らかなものに感じられただろう。
Just looking at it from the outside, it seemed a place of dazzling beauty, where a pair of young lovers might want to get married.

だが、この礼拝堂は金蔵にとってとても神聖なものだったらしく、楼座たち兄弟はみだりに近付くなと厳しく言われてきた。
However, Kinzo apparently viewed it as a very sacred place, so Rosa and her siblings had been given strict instructions not to approach it unnecessarily.

だから、この歳になり、どのような理由をつけたにしろ、礼拝堂に近付くことにある種の罪悪感と、父親に頬を打たれるほどに怒られるに違いないという恐怖感を感じるのだった…。
Even though they were all grown up now, approaching the chapel for any reason would still make them feel guilty...and also afraid, as if their Father might get angry and hit them in the face...

礼拝堂の入り口の前には、使用人たちの人影があった。郷田に紗音に嘉音。
……早番の使用人たちが全て集まっていることになる。
The servants' silhouettes could be seen in front of the chapel's entrance. Gohda, Shannon and Kanon.

...Which meant that all of the servants on the morning shift had gathered.

楼座は源次に先ほど、どういう事態になっているのか口頭では聞かされていた。
しかし、…実際に目にしなければ、とても理解できなかった…。
A short while ago, Genji had spoken to Rosa, telling her what the situation was.

However, ...without laying eyes on it directly, she definitely hadn't been able to understand...

おそらく、集まっている使用人たちもみんなそうなのだ。
It was probably the same for all the servants gathered here as well.

……~ib~自分の目で見なければ~ib~、何が起こっているのか、理解できないのだ。
...~ib~Without seeing it with their own eyes~ib~, they wouldn't have been able to understand what was going on.

礼拝堂の入り口の扉に、……大きく大きく、……血を思わせるネバついた不気味な塗料のようなもので、…不気味な魔法陣のようなものが描かれていたからだ。
On the door at the entrance to the chapel...was something very large, ...drawn with a creepy, stringy paint that made one think of blood... ...Something like a creepy magic circle.

「な、
………何よ、
……これ…………。いつ書かれたの？！」
"...Wh-

What is...

...this...? When was it drawn here?!"




使用人たちは顔を見合わせる。
最初に口を開いたのは郷田だった。
The servants looked at each other.

Gohda was the first to open his mouth.

「…も、…申し訳ございません。普段はここへは立ち入りませんもので、いつ書かれたのかはわかりません。」
"...M-My apologies. We don't usually enter this building, so we don't know when it was made."

「じゃあ、最初に見つけたのは誰？！」
"Then who was the first person to find it?!"

「はッ、…はい、私です。……食堂へお茶の道具の片付けに行きましたら、……礼拝堂と書かれたメモがあったもので…。」
"I-It was me. ...When I went to the dining hall to clean up the tea set, ...I found a memo with `chapel' written on it..."

紗音が震える手でメモを差し出す。
Shannon held out the memo with a shaking hand.

「……誰の字？　兄さんや姉さんの字ではないわね。…それで、あなたはここへ来て、これを見つけたのね。」
"...Whose handwriting is it? It isn't Nii-san's or Nee-san's. ...So, after that, you came here and found this, right?"

「はい……。」
"Yes..."

「…楼座さま、………これを。」
"...Rosa-sama, ......look at this."

「何？　……………ハッピーハロウィン、フォー、
"What? <......Happy Halloween...for...>

……えッ？！」
...What?!"

嘉音が、不気味な魔法陣の下に書かれた一行の英文を指し示す。
Kanon pointed at a single line of English written below the creepy magic circle.

指摘されるまで、魔法陣の図形の一部だと思い込んでしまっていて気付かなかった。
Until it had been pointed out to her, she'd thought it was just another part of the magic circle.

そしてそこには英語で、
There, the following words were written in English:

“Happy_HALLOWEEN_for_MARIA.”と記されていた。


——楽しいハロウィンを。真里亞へ。
Happy Halloween... For Maria...

不気味な魔法陣。真里亞へ。
This creepy magic circle...was for Maria.

ハッピーハロウィン。


昨日、真里亞にハッピーハロウィンという言葉を掛けた唯一の人物……。
記号が合致する。
Yesterday, only one person had said to Maria...

The key phrase matched.

……黄金の魔女、ベアトリーチェ…！
...It was the Golden Witch, Beatrice...!

「ま、真里亞は？！　あの子、いとこたちと一緒に寝てるはずよね？　確認した？！」
"Wh-What about Maria?! She should be sleeping with her cousins, right? Did you check?!"

「……申し訳ございません。真里亞さまのお名前が書かれていたことには、今気付きましたもので。…まだ確認しておりません。至急、」
"...My apologies. We just now realized that Maria-sama's name was written here. ...We still have not checked. Quickly-"

「何やってんのよッ！！　私は真里亞の様子を見てきます！　それから、蔵臼兄さんたちにも知らせて。以後の対応の指示を受けて！」
"What are you doing?!! I'll go check on Maria and come back! Tell Krauss nii-san and the rest too. After that, follow their instructions!"

…楼座はそこまで言ってから、ようやく違和感に気付く。
...After saying that much, Rosa finally noticed that something was odd.

この親族会議における自分の序列は、４兄弟の末席だ。
Her own rank in this family conference was the lowest of the four siblings.

……このような異常事態が起こって、どうして自分だけが呼び出されて、他の兄弟たちは呼び出されないのか。
...Why had she been the only one called during an abnormal situation like this, when the other siblings hadn't been?

…仮に真里亞の名があったとしても。
...Even if Maria's name had popped up.

「まさか、……え？　……え？！」
"Could it be...huh? ...What?!"

「……は、はい。旦那様にご連絡申し上げようとしたのですが、
…お姿が見当たらず…。」
"...Y-Yes. We tried to contact Krauss-sama,

...but we couldn't find him..."

「奥様もお部屋におられません。…シーツの様子からすると、昨夜はベッドに戻られていないのかもしれません。」
"And Madam was not in her room. ...Judging by the condition of the sheets, she might not have returned to her bed at all last night."

楼座は自分の背中を、ざらりざらりと、不気味なものが這い上がってくるのを感じる…。
Rosa felt something creepy crawling slowly up her back...

「………れ、…礼拝堂の中は確認した？」
「いえ、まだです。確認しようとはしたのですが…。」
"......D-Did you check inside the chapel?"

"No, not yet. We tried, but..."

「……実は、礼拝堂の鍵は特別で、マスターキーに対応しておりません。一本だけある鍵でしか開けられないのですが、……その鍵がキーボックスから紛失しているのです。」
"...Actually, the lock to the chapel is special, so the master key will not work. There is a single key that can open it, ...but that key is missing from the key box."

不気味な魔法陣の描かれた扉になど、できるものなら近付きたくない。
She didn't want to get closer to the door with the creepy magic circle if she could.

楼座は意を決して近付き、そのノブを押したり引いたりしてみる。
…頑丈な施錠の手応えを感じるだけだった。
Rosa readied herself and approached, then tried pushing and pulling the knob.

...All she felt was the resistance of the sturdy lock.

「入れる窓などがないか、探しては見たのですが…。もし中を確認するのでしたら、窓を破らなければならないかと思います…。いかがいたしましょう。」
"We searched to see if there was a window we could enter through, but... I think we'd have to break one of the windows if we wanted to check inside... What do you think?"

「…そんな許可、私に出せるわけがないわ。お父様の大切な礼拝堂なのよ、そんなことできないわよ。…………………。」
"...There's no way I can give you approval to do something like that. This is Father's precious chapel. ........."

その時、楼座の脳裏に昨日の出来事が蘇る…。
At that time, the events of the previous day swirled around in the back of Rosa's mind...

　……そうだ、
……あの魔女は薔薇庭園で出会った時、
…真里亞に、封筒を渡していなかったっけ。
...That's right,

...when I met that witch in the rose garden,

...didn't she hand Maria an envelope?




そうだ、間違いない、渡していた。
Yeah, there's no mistake, she did hand it over.

開けようとする真里亞に、まだ開けるなと言ってから、“~ib~それを開ける時はすぐ訪れる~ib~”と、確かに言っていた…。
When Maria tried to open it, the witch told her not to do it yet, and then she surely said: "~ib~The time to open that will come soon~ib~"...

楼座は確信する。
……間違いない。
……真里亞に渡された、あの封筒…………。
Rosa was sure.

...There could be no mistake.

...The envelope Maria had received was......

楼座はゲストハウスへ駆けて戻ると、足音を忍ばせながらいとこ部屋に近付き、そっと扉を開け、中をうかがう…。
After dashing back to the guesthouse, Rosa approached the cousin room while hiding her footsteps, softly opened the door, and peered inside...

中からは、若者らしい元気のいいいびきが聞こえてきた。
子どもたちは４人いる。真里亞もいる。…すやすやと眠っていた。
From the inside, she could hear the healthy snores typical of young people.

There were four children. And Maria was there. ...Sleeping soundly.

ほっと胸を撫で下ろしてから、忍び足で室内に入る。
……目指すのは、ソファーの上に置かれている真里亞の手提げだった。
After breathing a sigh of relief, she entered the room with quiet footsteps.

...She was after Maria's handbag, which was resting on the sofa.

真里亞は、自分の宝物をいつも持ち歩きたがる。
…母親が常に化粧道具を肌身離さず持ち歩いていることの模倣だろう。
Maria always liked carrying her treasures around with her.

...She was probably emulating how her mother always carried her makeup with her.

もちろん、単なる物真似だから、その中身はがらくたばかりだ。
Of course, she was just imitating her mother, so everything on the inside was junk.

真里亞の場合は、オカルトを想起させる不気味な小物や、それが記された自由帳などだ。
In Maria's case, it was full of small, creepy, occult items, notebooks describing things of that nature, and so on.

……こんな女の子らしくないものを、楼座は持ち歩いて欲しいなどと思ったことは一度もない。
...Rosa had never been happy to see her daughter walking around with things like that, which weren't girlish at all.

しかし、無理にやめさせようとして、ものすごい大喧嘩をして以来、それには触れないようにしていた。
However, trying to force Maria to stop had resulted in a big fight, so she'd decided to let it be.

「………………………、…あった。………これね………。」
".........Here. ......This is it......"

黄金の鷲の紋章の入った洋形封筒…。
A Western envelope with the crest of the gold eagle...

取り出してみると、中に重たい棒状の物が入っているのがわかった。
When she took it out of the bag, she realized there was a heavy, vaguely cylindrical object inside.

…重さと手触りでわかる。
……間違いない。
これは、……鍵だ。
...She could tell by its feel and its weight.

...There was no doubt.

This was...a key.

楼座は、一度振り返り、真里亞が熟睡しているのを確認した後、一息に封筒を破き、中身を手の平の上に零した。
After turning around and checking that Maria was still sound asleep, Rosa tore open the envelope, and the contents spilled out into her palm.

……それは、古く凝った意匠の施された鍵だった…。
...It was a key with an old and intricate design...

楼座はその鍵を握り締め、駆け出していく。
Rosa gripped that key and dashed out.

…その音に、戦人が気付いたようだが、むにゃむにゃ言いながら寝返りをうつと、再びいびきをかき始めるのだった…。
...Battler seemed to have noticed that sound, but after grumbling and turning over in his sleep, he started snoring again...

「……源次さん。……この鍵、……ひょっとして礼拝堂の鍵ということは…？」
"...Genji-san, ...could this key...be the key to the chapel?"

「これをどこで……。…はい、これが礼拝堂の鍵です。」
"Where did you... ...Yes, this is the key to the chapel."

楼座は再び、不気味な魔法陣に近付き、……鍵穴に鍵を入れる。
Rosa approached the creepy magic circle once again...and put the key in the keyhole.

……硬い手応え。
しばらくの間、抵抗した後、…がちゃりという音と共にその抵抗をやめた。
...There was a strong resistance.

After it resisted for a short while, ...it stopped resisting with a clunk.

そして、耳障りな音で軋みながら、ゆっくりとゆっくりとその扉を開けていく………。
Then, squeaking with a noise that hurt one's ears, ...it slowly, slowly began to open......

「……………誰か、……いるの…………！」
"......Is anyone...there......?!"

その声は広大な室内に反響する。
…もちろん応えるものなどない。
Her voice reverberated throughout the massive room.

...Of course, there was no answer.

礼拝堂は天井が高く、空気が冷え切っている。
The chapel had a high ceiling, and the air was cold.

…そして、こんなにも薄気味の悪い雨を降らせる日にあっても、どこか神々しさを感じさせるのだった…。
...And even on this rainy, unsettling day, it felt sacred for some reason...

楼座に続き、使用人たちもおっかなびっくりと後に続いた。
The servants timidly followed after Rosa.

「……楼座さま、あれを。」
嘉音がすぐにそれに気付き、指差す。
"...Rosa-sama, look at that."

Kanon noticed it immediately and pointed.

……そこは、祭壇。
...Over there...was the altar.

本来、牧師が神の愛を説くべき場所に、あってはならないテーブルが置かれていた。
In the place that would normally have a pastor preaching of God's love, there was a table that shouldn't have been there.

それの第一印象は、食卓だった。
…現に、そのテーブルの上には、華やかな皿や器が置かれ、まるで子どものお誕生会か何かを連想させた。
At first, it looked like a dining table.

...There actually were gorgeous plates and utensils placed there, making it look like a child's birthday party or something.

見れば、周りも、カボチャ飾りや、黒や橙のリボンで飾られている。
多分、それは、……ハロウィンの飾りつけなのだ。
Upon closer inspection, the surrounding area had been decorated with pumpkins and black and orange ribbons.

They were probably...Halloween decorations.

そして、そのテーブルには着席者たちがいた。
３人ずつがそれぞれ向かい合うように椅子に座っている。
And there were people seated at the table.

Three people on each side facing each other, seated in chairs.

一目でわかる。
蔵臼夫婦と絵羽夫婦、そして留弗夫夫婦だった。
They could be recognized at a glance.

Krauss and his wife, Eva and her husband, and Rudolf and his wife.

だが、それが間違いなくそうかと言われたら、もっと近付いて確認しなくてはならなかった。
But if you wanted to be sure, you'd still have to go even closer and check.

……なぜなら、まるで人形のような気配だったからだ。
...Because they seemed almost like dolls.

扉を開き、どやどやと入り込み、誰かいないかと声を掛けた。
Rosa and the rest had opened the door, entered all at once with the sound of many footsteps, and called out, asking if anyone was there.

…にもかかわらず、何の反応も示さない。
…仮に無視を決め込んでいたとしても、普通なら少しは何かの反応を示す。
...And yet, there had been no reaction.

...Even if Rosa and the rest assumed they were being ignored, you'd still expect there to be some kind of reaction.

……それすらもないのだ。
...And there hadn't even been that.

だから第一印象は、彼らによく似た人形が座らせられていると、そう感じたのだ…。
So at first, it felt like someone had set down some dolls that greatly resembled those people...

……今や、楼座だけではない。
……紗音も嘉音も、そして郷田も。
…湧き上がる不気味な感情に心臓が鷲掴みにされるような気持ちと必死に戦っていた。
...By now, it wasn't just Rosa.

...Shannon and Kanon, and even Gohda.

...They were all fighting frantically with the creepy emotion that grasped their hearts.

「……兄さん…？　………姉さん………？」
祭壇に歩み寄りながら、なおも声を掛けるが、それでも彼らが反応を返すことはなかった。
"...Nii-san...? ......Nee-san......?"

As she walked towards the altar, she called out again, but there was still no reaction.

……あぁ、…もう楼座は自分で認めている。
...Yes, ...by now, Rosa was sure of it.

……彼らが人形ではなく、~ib~彼らそのものであることを認めている~ib~……！
...She was sure these weren't dolls, ~ib~but the people themselves~ib~...!

「…………これは………。」
"......This is......"

「………………。」
"........."

テーブルの上の様子がよくわかるくらいにまで距離が近付く。
They grew close enough to see clearly what lay on the table.

それは、第一印象の通り、子どものお誕生会かパーティを思わせるような、可愛らしい宴に見えた。
It still looked like an adorable banquet, reminiscent of a child's birthday party.

お皿に盛り付けられたお菓子や、可愛らしい飲み物の器。
カボチャ型に切り抜いた飾り等々…。
Plates piled up with sweets, cute pitchers with drinks.

All kinds of pumpkin-shaped ornaments...

…それらはハロウィン風に飾られていて、…こんな時に的外れな想像だが…、きっと真里亞が見たら喜ぶに違いないと思った。
...They were all decorated in a Halloween style, ...and while this probably wasn't the time to be thinking it, Maria would surely have been delighted to see all this.

そんな、テーブルを前に、彼らは着席し、眠っているように見えた……。
That was the state of the table they sat in front of, apparently asleep...

楽しそうなハロウィンの小パーティの最中に、…時間を止めてしまったかのような、不思議な光景…。
It was an eerie scene, ...as though a small, fun-looking Halloween party had been stopped in time...

「……兄さんたち……。……寝てるの…？　……………？」
"...They're all......sleeping...? ......?"

彼らにさらに近付くと、……床にたくさんのお菓子が散らばっているのがわかった。
When she approached even closer to them, ...she realized that there were snacks scattered all over the floor.

それはとてもファンシーな包み紙に包んだ飴玉や、クッキー、ラムネにチョコレート…。
Candies, cookies, soda and chocolates, ...all with heavily fantasy-themed packaging...

そして、それらはブラックベリーとクランベリーのジャムいっぱいの絨毯の上にばら撒かれていた…。
They were all scattered across a carpet covered with blackberry and cranberry jam...

「……わ、うわあああああぁああああああああぁッ？！」
"...Wa, uwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa?!"




楼座たちは、………ようやく状況を理解する……。
Rosa and the rest......finally realized what the situation was...

それは、ハロウィンのパーティ。
この世ならぬ者たちの宴…！
It was...a Halloween party.

A banquet for those not of this world...!

蔵臼、夏妃、絵羽、秀吉、留弗夫、霧江の６人は、椅子に座り、……眠るように死んでいたのだ。
Krauss, Natsuhi, Eva, Hideyoshi, Rudolf, and Kyrie were seated in chairs, apparently asleep, ...but all dead.

どうして眠っているのではなく、死んでいると言い切れるのか？
How could you tell that they were dead and not simply sleeping?

　それは、
………彼らが、
……胸元から腹にかけて、
………た、
…縦に、
………裂かれて………！
That was because...

they'd been...

v-

vertically...

...sliced open...

...from their chests to their stomachs......!




「だ、……旦那様…………！！
"...K-Krauss-sama......!!




ひぃいいぃぃぃぃぃ……！」

"Thank you?!! Did you say I should thank you, you old bitch?! Damn it, if there's something wrong with your ears, I'll cut them both off so you can hear better!! Why should I have to see that insane way of killing and say `Oh, thank you very much Beatrice-sama'?! I'll beat your brains out!!!"




「前回のゲームで。お前は自分の親の死に顔が見れないと嘆いたな？　だから残したぞ。しっかり残したッ！！
"In the last game, you lamented the fact that you couldn't see your parents faces after they died, yes? So this time, I left them. Didn't touch them!!

~ib~よく拝んでおけ、間違いなく父親たちが殺されたことを~ib~！！」
~ib~Take a good look, for without a doubt, your father and the rest have been killed~ib~!!"

「そ……ぅかよ、そいつぁサービス満点だぜ、気に入った！！
"R...eally, what a nice treat, I'm so fucking happy!!

俺はてめぇの息の根を止めたら顔面耕してやろうと誓ってたが、そいつは取り消してやるぜ、てめぇのハラワタを引きずり出してやるッ！！！」
I swore I'd plow your face after I choked the life out of you, but I'll take that back now. I'll rip out your guts instead!!!"

「感情に任せて思考を止めるな。すでに妾のゲームは始まっておるのだぞ？　くっくっくくくく。妾は今回は綺麗に死体を残すことに決めた。」
"Don't give in to emotion, don't stop thinking. My game has already begun, right? *cackle*cackle*cackle* I decided to leave you neat and tidy corpses this time."

「なぜだかわかるか？　前回のゲームでそなたが妾の存在を否定する時、こう考えて否定したであろう。それは、
"Do you know why? When you denied my existence in the last game, you used this line of thinking..."

“~ib~顔面が潰され、遺体の身元が確認できない~ib~”
"~ib~`Their faces were crushed, so the identity of the corpses can't be confirmed.'~ib~

“~ib~だから身代わりの死体を用意してアリバイを作った可能性が否定できない~ib~”
~ib~`Therefore, we can't eliminate the possibility that fake corpses were prepared to create an alibi.'~ib~

“~ib~その可能性が排除できない限り、人間犯人説は維持できる~ib~”！！」
~ib~`Unless that possibility's denied, a human culprit theory can still be built'~ib~!!"

「何だとぉおおぉッ……！！」
"What'd you saaaaaay...?!!"

"*cackle*cackle*cackle*kikikikikikikikikikikikikikikikikikikiki!! So, Battler, is it okay to leave the examination of the corpses to Nanjo? Isn't it traditional in mystery novels for the doctor who performs such examinations to be an accomplice?"

「なら南條に検死を任せるな、そなたが自らするが良い。間違いなく、６人の死体が当人で、死んだふりなどでなく、本当の本当に死んでいることを充分に確認するがいいッ！！」
"Then don't leave the examination to him. Do it yourself. Make completely sure that without a doubt, the six corpses are the six people they're supposed to be, that they really, really are dead, not just pretending!!"

「お前の父親が、母親が、腹を裂かれて臓物を引きずり出されて殺されていることを、腹に手を入れてその手触りで確認するがいいッ！！！
"If you wish to confirm that your Father and Mother have been killed by having their stomachs cut open and their entrails pulled out, you'd better stick your hand inside their stomachs and feel around!!

くっはははははははははははははははははははは、きーっはっはっははははははははははははははははッ！！」
Kuhahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha, ki-hahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha!!"

「泣かねぇッ！！！
"I won't cry!!!

畜生ォ畜生ォ、…泣かねぇぞ俺は…！！」
突然、戦人が叫ぶ。
Damn it, damn it, ...I won't cry...!!"

Battler suddenly yelled.

彼はまだ涙を零し続けていたが、自らにそれを女々しいと叱り付けるかのように、両手で顔面を力強く何度か叩いた。
His tears were still dripping down, but as though scolding himself for being a sissy, he slapped his face hard several times with both hands.

それでもまだ涙は止まらない。
……しかし、両の目に熱い炎が点るのがわかった。
Even so, the tears still wouldn't stop.

...However, he felt a hot blaze in both his eyes.

「これだけの上等を決めやがった野郎に、借りはがっちり返させていただくぜッ！！　なら泣く時じゃねぇ、自分のすべきことを考えろ！！　あぁ、駄目だぜ、全然駄目だ！！　涙を流す暇があったら考えろ！　涙腺なんか弛ませる時じゃねぇッ！！」
"Whoever's responsible for this piece of work, I'll make them pay back their debt completely!! So this isn't the time to cry, gotta think about what to do!! Aaaah, it's useless, it's all useless!! If you've got enough time to cry, then think! This is no time to let yourself cry!!"

それは、純粋な怒りというよりは、悲しみを塗り潰すための逃避的な怒りだったかもしれない。
Rather than genuine anger, maybe it was more of an evasive anger to blot out his sadness.

……しかし、悲しみに押し潰されていた譲治や朱志香に、わずかの勇気を与える。
...However, it gave a little courage to George and Jessica, who'd been crushed by the sadness.

「……そうだね。…僕たちが泣いても、

"...That's right. ...Even if we cry,

...it won't change the reality...

of what has happened."

"Damn it, ...damn it damn it damn it, ...damn it damn it damn it!! Then what should we do?! What should I do...for Mom and Dad's sakes?!!"

「……楼座さま…。戻りました…。」
"...Rosa-sama... I have returned..."

「郷田さん、警察はどうでしたか。対応の指示は？　いつ頃来られそうだと言っていましたか？」
"Gohda-san, what happened with the police? What did they say to do? Did they say when they think they'll be able to get here?"

「…それが、……電話が故障のようでして…。非常用の無線機も試しては見たのですが、…その、天候のせいでしょうか、こちらも通じず…。」
"...As to that, ...it seems the phones have broken down... I also tried the emergency wireless, but...umm, maybe it's the weather, but that isn't working either..."

「何ですって…！　じゃあ、警察に連絡がつかないということなの？！」
"What did you say...?! So, we can't contact the police?!"

「あいつだッ！　あいつが電話線とかに細工して、警察に電話ができないようにしたんだ！！」
"It's that person! They did something to the phone line, made it so we can't reach the cops!!"

電話の故障を聞き、朱志香はすぐにそれを謎の来客の仕業だと断定する。
その目は泣き腫らして真っ赤で、そして怒りでさらに真っ赤に血走っていた。
When she heard that the phones had broken down, Jessica immediately decided that it was the work of that mysterious guest.

Her eyes were bright-red after so much crying, and they began to grow even redder with rage.

「…あぁ、もう議論の余地なんかねぇぜ？！　全てがわかってる、そうだとわかる！　父さんと母さんを殺したのは誰だ？！」
"...Gah, there's no need to talk about it, right?! I understand everything, that's right, I get it! Who killed Dad and Mom?!"

「決まっているぜ、あいつだッ！！　昨日来たとかいう魔女さまに決まってるッ！！！　襟首、捻り上げてやるぜッ！！　畜生畜生畜生ォオオオ！！」
"It's obviously her!! It's gotta be that witch or whatever who came yesterday!!! I'll grab her by the collar!! Damn it damn it damn iiiiiiiiiiiit!!"

"Jessica-chan...! Wait! Gohda-san, Kanon-kun, go!"

「は、はい…！」
"Y-Yes Ma'am...!"

やり場のない悲しみを怒りで塗り潰し、感情を破裂させた朱志香は表へ駆け出していく。
Covering her uncontrollable sadness with anger, Jessica ran outside, torn apart by emotion.

…短絡的に考えるならば、昨日訪れた謎の来客、ベアトリーチェが怪しいのかもしれない。
しかし彼女が犯人であるとする証拠は現時点では何もない。
...Thinking about it hastily, maybe the mystery guest who'd arrived yesterday, Beatrice, was suspicious.

However, in that instant, there was absolutely no proof that she was the culprit.

…この瞬間においては、彼女は単なる客人のひとりでしかないのだ。
...At this moment, she's just another guest, no more, no less.

だから楼座は大人の判断から、朱志香の短絡的な暴走を止めさせなければならなかった。
すぐにそれを郷田も嘉音も理解し、その背中を追った。
So Rosa, making an adult decision, was forced to stop Jessica in her rash rampage.

Gohda and Kanon picked up on this immediately and chased after her.

"I understand how Jessica feels. ...I wish I could think that too. It doesn't matter who, I want someone to be the culprit so I can bash them right in the face!!

俺は顔すら見てねぇぜ！！」
I haven't even seen her face!!"

"Beatrice is a witch. And the ceremony to open the door to the Golden Land has finally begun. Those six people are sacrifices. ...Kihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihi! "Maria, don't I always tell you not to laugh with that creepy voice?!"

The crisp sound of Rosa slapping Maria's cheek echoed through the high-ceilinged chapel...

何だか、昨日の雨が降り出してから。
いや、…この島が台風に包まれてから何かがおかしくなってしまった気がする。
Ever since it started raining yesterday...

No, ...ever since the island was swallowed by the typhoon, I've felt as though something...was wrong.

俺は晴れている内に六軒島を訪れ、朝が早かったので眠くなり昼寝をした。
It was bright and sunny when I arrived on Rokkenjima, but since I'd gotten up early and was sleepy, I took a nap.

……起きた時にはもう雨が降り出していた。
...When I woke up, it had already started raining.

そして起きた時からだ。
And ever since that time...

いつの間にか、黄金の魔女ベアトリーチェを名乗る謎の客人が来ていて、何だかおかしな世界に少しずつ傾いていた気がする。
Suddenly, a mysterious visitor calling herself the Golden Witch Beatrice arrived, and it felt like I was sinking bit by bit into a bizarre world.

俺が昼寝している間に何があったってんだ？　その間に、この島はこの世の常識の通用しない異世界へ切り取られちまったってのか…？！
What the heck happened while I was napping? Am I supposed to believe this island was sealed off inside a different world, where common sense doesn't apply...?!

ベアトリーチェというのは何者なんだ。
Who is this person called Beatrice?

昨日の晩餐で親父たちが騒いでいたように、遺産相続問題に絡もうとする未知の人物なのか。
Is some unknown person trying to involve themselves with the inheritance problem, just like our parents were freaking out about at dinner last night?

……それとも真里亞がのたまうように、黄金伝説の魔女さまが犯人だってのかよ？！
...Or is the culprit this witch from the Legend of the Gold, just like Maria said?!

朱志香が短気を起こすまでもなく、この状況下ではその来客が一番怪しいだろう。
しかし、それで決め付けちゃ駄目だ。あぁ駄目だ駄目だ、全然駄目だぜ…！！
Even if we set Jessica's temper aside, given the circumstances, it's probably safe to say that this visitor person is the most suspicious.

But we mustn't make up our minds based on that alone. Aaah, it's useless, it's useless, it's all useless...!!

俺はもう一度顔面を両手でぴしゃりと叩き付け、加熱した脳みそを冷やした。
焼け石に水かもしれないとしても。
I smacked my face with both hands again, cooling off my brains before they overloaded.

Even though it might've been a wasted effort...

「……これは、………お祖父さまの封筒。」

譲治の兄貴が、テーブル上に飾るように盛り付けられた菓子皿の上に、右代宮家の紋章を箔押しした洋形封筒が置かれているのを見つける。
On a tray piled up with sweets that decorated the table, George-aniki found a Western envelope that had the Ushiromiya family crest done on it in gold leaf.

そしてそれは未開封だった。
And, it was unopened.

...A folded letter came out.

「………読むよ。
"......I'll read it.

………六軒島へようこそ、右代宮家の皆様方。私は、金蔵さまにお仕えしております、当家顧問錬金術師のベアトリーチェと申します…。」
......Welcome to Rokkenjima, members of the Ushiromiya family. I am Beatrice, the alchemist for this family employed by Kinzo-sama himself..."

それは実にふざけた手紙だった。
That letter really was a joke.

自分のことを顧問錬金術師と名乗ったベアトリーチェは、祖父さまに貸した黄金を利子付きで回収すると宣言していた。
This Beatrice, who called herself the family alchemist, had announced that she was collecting the gold she'd lent Grandfather, along with interest.

その利子とは、祖父さまが生み出したモノ、全て。
And that interest...was everything Grandfather had created.

この惨劇を目の当たりにしてこの一文を読み上げたなら、それは祖父さまが築き上げた財産全てだけを指したりはしない。
Since this tragedy was right before our eyes as this paragraph was being read aloud, it clearly wasn't referring just to the wealth that Grandfather had built up.

……文字通りのこと。
祖父さまが生み出したモノ、……つまり、…祖父さまの子孫たちも全てベアトリーチェの利子に含まれることになる！
...It was literal.

Everything that Grandfather had created... ...In other words, ...all of Grandfather's descendants were included in the interest!

「ふざけやがってッ！！

何てめちゃくちゃな契約だ！　黄金の利子は命だってのかよ？！　そんなのまるで悪魔の契約じゃねぇかよ！　それで魔女気取りってわけかッ？！　はッ、笑わせやがるぜ！！」
What a screwed up contract! Lives as interest for gold, you say?! That's almost like a contract with the devil, isn't it?! You think that makes you look more like a witch?! Ha, don't make me laugh!!"

「……特別条項。………ただし、隠された契約の黄金を暴いた者が現れた時、ベアトリーチェはこの権利を全て永遠に放棄しなければならない。」
"...Special clause. ......However, if someone is able to discover the hidden gold of this contract, Beatrice must abandon these rights for all time."

"......Hmm... ...Kinzo-sama has already publicly displayed the location of the hidden gold within the epitaph under my portrait..."

"...In other words, it's something like this. If these murders represent her collecting interest, then she's telling us to try and find the gold she gave Grandfather if we want her to stop... And, she's also saying that the secret pointing to the gold is hidden in the portrait epitaph."

"So, basically, ...this is a letter of challenge from the witch? She's telling us to try and solve the code that points to the hidden gold, if we can?! And if we can't, she'll keep collecting the interest as planned?"

The table was covered with sweets, ...so even though those things were right out in the open, we just assumed they were sweets too.

「…片翼の鷲の紋章が刻印されてる…。…前に母さんが話してたのを聞いた。……これはお祖父さまの黄金伝説の金塊だよ…！！」
"...It's inscribed with the crest of the One-Winged Eagle... ...I heard Mother talking about this earlier. ...This is a gold bar from Grandfather's Legend of the Gold...!!"

ひとつ１０ｋｇも重さがある黄金のインゴットが、…何と三つも、テーブルの真ん中に積み上げられていた！　そこはお誕生会だったならケーキが置かれているような場所だ。
Gold ingots weighing a full 10 kilograms...a whole three of them...were piled up in the very center of the table! It was where a cake would be placed if it was a birthday party.

…つまり、紛れもなくこいつは、親族会議って名のお誕生会のバースデーケーキ！
...In other words, this was without a doubt the birthday cake of the party known as the family conference!

...nng, *gulp*. I-It's worth about 60 million yen!"

"Dumbaaaaaaaaaaasss!!!

That's too cheap!!! Our parents have been killed, and all you've got is this pile of just 60 million yen in gold?!

馬鹿にするんじゃねぇえええぇええぇッ！！！」
Don't take us for fools, damn iiiiiiiiiiiiiiiit!!!"

"...Kihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihi. ...So, it has begun, Beatrice. ...It's not like anyone can solve this riddle anyway. So Beato will definitely win."

"...Quickly, open the door to the Golden Land. And take me with you. ...Kihihihihihihihihihihihihihi!"

「お嬢様、どうか気をお静め下さい…！」
"Milady, please, calm yourself...!"

「誰が犯人かはまだわかりませんぞ！　それにベアトリーチェさまは、お館様の大切な賓客です…！」
"We still don't know who the culprit is! And Beatrice-sama is an important and honored guest of the Master's...!"

「だから何だってんだッ！！　本人の胸倉、捻り上げてやれば白状するに決まってるぜ！！　目を見ればわかるんだよッ！！　私が見破ってやる！！　何が魔女だベアトリーチェだッ！！　バケの皮を剥いでやるッ！！」
"So what?!! If we grab her by the collar, she'll definitely confess!! If I can just look her in the eye, I'll know. I'll see through her!! A witch?! Beatrice?!! Yeah, right! I'll expose her!!"

朱志香は決して足を止めなかった。
郷田と嘉音は早足に追いながら懸命に説得を続けるが、朱志香は決して耳を貸そうとはしなかった。
Jessica never stopped moving.

Gohda and Kanon chased after her, doing their best to convince her to stop, but Jessica never lent them an ear.

やがて、“魔女の貴賓室”が見えてくる。
この貴賓室は、決して使われることのない開かずの間だった。
Eventually, the witch's VIP room came into view.

This VIP room was always sealed and never used.

…どのような来客であっても、金蔵はこの部屋に通さなかったのだ。
……なのに、使用人たちには常にこの部屋を掃除させ、いつでも使用できるようにさせていた。
...No matter what kind of guest came, Kinzo wouldn't let them in there.

...And yet, the servants were always made to clean this room, so that it could be used at any time.

だからこの部屋を使用人たちは、姿なきもうひとりの主の部屋、“魔女の貴賓室”と呼ぶようになっていたのだ。
So the servants had started calling this room the witch's VIP room, after their second, shapeless master.

それは朱志香も知っていた。
そして、その貴賓室に泊まることで、自らを魔女と名乗る傲慢が許せなかった。
Jessica knew about this too.

And she couldn't forgive the arrogance of the one who called herself a witch by staying in that room.

……黄金の魔女などおとぎ話だ。
何が魔女だ！　自分にとっては、両親を惨たらしく殺した殺人者以上でも以下でもない！
...The Golden Witch was just a fairy tale.

Come on, a witch?! To Jessica, she was nothing more or less than the murderer who had brutally killed her parents!

問い詰められ、苦しい言い訳を吐き、苦しい唾を吐いて苦しい息を吐いて。
Question her, hear her pitiful excuses, make her splutter in pain, gasp in anguish.

…どんなに魔女を装おうとも、汗臭いニオイのするニンゲンであることを教えてやるッ！！
...No matter how hard she pretends to be a witch, I'll teach her that she's just a stinking, sweaty Human!!

朱志香はあらん限りの力と大声をあげながら、貴賓室の扉を叩く。
As Jessica yelled with all of her strength, she hit the door to the VIP room.

それは断じてノックではない。
It definitely wasn't a knock.

…開けぬなら打ち破ってやるという怒りの槌の打撲音だった。
...That sound was the beating of her anger's hammer, as if she was determined to break the door down if it wasn't opened.

「開けろよッ、ベアトリーチェ！！　出て来い！！　聞こえてるんだろう？！　ここを開けろッ！！！」
"Open up, Beatrice!! Come out!! You hear me, right?! Open up!!!"

返事はない。
There was no answer.

…朱志香は構わずトアノブを捻るが、施錠の手応えがあった。
朱志香は使用人の二人に振り返り言い放つ。
...Jessica grabbed the doorknob without any reservation, but she felt the resistance of the lock.

She turned around to look at the two servants and spoke.

「ここマスターキーで開くんでしょ？！　開けてッ！！」
"The master key'll unlock this, right?! Use it!!"

「お嬢様…！　それは大変な失礼に当たります…！！」
"Milady...! That would be horribly rude...!!"

郷田はおろおろしながらも、何とか朱志香の怒りを治めようとする。
Although Gohda was flustered, he still tried to somehow calm Jessica's anger.

……嘉音はしばらく無言で俯いていた後、上着のポケットからマスターキーを取り出した。
...After hanging his head silently for a while, Kanon pulled a master key from his jacket pocket.

「嘉音さん…！　いいんですか？！」
"Kanon-san...! Are you sure?!"

「……もしおられたなら、無礼になるのは承知です。………それに。…もし、ベアトリーチェさまが何の関係もないというなら、それを僕たちに釈明して納得させればいい。」
"...Yes, I'm fully aware it would be rude if she happens to be in there. ......At any rate, ...if Beatrice had nothing to do with that incident, all she has to do is give us a satisfying explanation."

「そ、……そうだぜ、その通りだ！！　借りるぜッ！」
"...Th-That's right, exactly!! Lemme borrow that!"

朱志香は嘉音の手からマスターキーを引っ手繰ると、それを乱暴に鍵穴にねじ込む。
…すぐに軽やかな音がして開錠の手応えがした。
Jessica snatched the master key from Kanon's hand and violently shoved it into the keyhole.

...Immediately, there was a small sound, and she felt the lock click.

そして断ることなく、その扉を開け放つ。
Then, without asking permission, she flung the door open.

「ベアトリーチェッ！！！　どこだ？！　出て来い！！」
"Beatrice!! Where are you?! Come out!!"

朱志香は構わずずかずかと室内に踏み入る。
…魔女の姿はなかった。
Jessica rudely stepped into the room.

...The witch wasn't anywhere to be seen.

「…くそったれッ！！　いねぇぜ！！　どこに行きやがったッ？！」
"...That bitch!! She's not here!! Where the hell'd she go?!"

「………お、お姿がありませんね…。」
"......Y-Yes, she doesn't seem to be here..."

朱志香は室内のどこかに隠れているかもしれないと、カーテンの陰やベッドの下を覗き込んだが、見つけることはできなかった。
Jessica, thinking she might be hiding somewhere inside the room, peeked behind the curtains and under the bed, but she couldn't find anyone.

でも、確かにベッドには使用の痕跡があって、……曖昧な言い方なのだが、部屋の空気が少しだけ柔らかくなっていた。
However, there definitely were signs that the bed had been used...and though it was only a vague sense, the atmosphere in the room felt a little soft.

礼拝堂のような、普段は無人の場所の硬い空気ではない。
確かにこの部屋に人が宿泊していたことをうかがわせる気配がある。
It wasn't the hard atmosphere of a place normally devoid of people, like the chapel.

You could definitely tell that someone had spent the night in this room.

しかし姿はなかった。
But she could not be seen.

実を言うと、朱志香も郷田も、まだベアトリーチェには会っていない。
In reality, neither Jessica nor Gohda had met Beatrice.

…肖像画に瓜二つの人物だと会った人間たちに聞かされただけだ。
...They had only been told by those who had met her that she looked like a double of the character in that portrait.

…だから、実際はどんな顔をしているのだろうと訝しがっていた。
...So, they were doubtful about what her face really looked like.

…しかし、嘉音だけは会っている。
...However, Kanon alone had met her.

そしてあの魔女がどういう存在で、……どんな性分なのかを理解している。
He understood what kind of being that witch was, ...what kind of personality she had.

だから、自分たちが彼女の姿を求めてここへ押しかけたなら、絶対、思い通りになどさせるわけがないのだ。
So, he knew that forcing their way in here in search for her...definitely wouldn't work out.

……空振りさせ、悔しがる自分たちをどこかで見ていて、嘲笑っているに決まっている。
……あいつはそういうヤツなのだ。
...She must be watching us bitterly flail about in vain from somewhere, sneering at us.

...She's that kind of person.

そういう目で見ていたから、嘉音が一番最初に見つけられた。
…他の二人は人影を探すことに集中していたから気付けなかったのだ。
Because he was looking at things that way, Kanon was the first to find it.

...The other two were concentrating on finding the shadow of a person, so they didn't notice.

サイドテーブルの上の水差しの脇に、便箋が一枚置かれていた。
短いメッセージと、それを書いたのだろう万年筆が添えられている…。
Near a water jug on the side table, there was a single sheet of letter paper.

On it was a short message, and nearby was a fountain pen, which had probably been used to write it...

嘉音は魔女を理解していた。
６人の死体を見つけて、怒りに駆られてここへ押し掛け、姿を見つけられない自分たちを、必ず魔女は嘲る。
Kanon had already come to understand the witch.

After finding the corpses, they'd been overcome by rage and barged in here, only to find no one, so of course the witch would mock them.

……嘲りは、それを伝えなければ成立しない。
だからつまり、…これはきっと、それ…！
...You can't mock someone unless they know they're being mocked.

So, in other words, ...that's what this must be...!

「……お嬢様。………ここに何か書かれています。」
"...Milady, ......there's something written here."

「書かれてるって、何だ？！」
"Something written? What?!"

朱志香はズカズカと早足にやって来ると、便箋を乱暴に奪った。
Jessica dashed over and violently snatched the piece of paper away.

……本人に乱暴なつもりはないのだろう。
…今は力の加減ができないだけだ。
...She probably wasn't trying to be violent.

...She just couldn't control her strength right now.

「………何だとぉ…？！　な、舐めやがってッ！！！」
メッセージを読んだ途端、朱志香は激しく怒り狂い、便箋をぐしゃぐしゃに丸めて叩きつける。
"......What the...?! D-Don't fuck with me!!!"

As soon as she read the message, Jessica went into a wild rage, crumpled the paper up, and threw it.

そして、ベッドサイドにあったインテリアスタンドを掴むと、それを乱暴に振り回して、それを壁や家具にひたすら叩き付けた。
Then, she grabbed an light stand by the bedside and violently swung it around, mercilessly hitting the walls and furniture with it.

…たちまち電球が破裂しその破片を辺りにばら撒いた。
...The lightbulbs all shattered at once, and the fragments were scattered across the room.

「お嬢様、気をお静め下さい…！　お怪我をなさいます！！」
"Milady, please calm down...! You'll hurt yourself!!"

「離せよッ！！　畜生畜生ォ！
"Let go!! Damn it, damn it!

出て来やがれベアトリーチェッ！！　よくも父さんと母さんをッ！！　そんなに私が怖ぇかよッ！！
Come out, Beatrice!! How could you do that to Mom and Dad?!! You think you scare me?!!

殺してやる殺してやる！！　ブッ殺してやるから姿を現しやがれッ！！！　だから離せって言ってんだろッ、くっそおおおおおぉおぉお！！」
I'll kill you, I'll kill you!! I'll beat you to death, so show yourself!!! I told you to let go of me, damn iiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiit!!"




便箋にはこう書かれていた…。
This was written on the paper...

“私がぬくぬくとここで、貴方が飛び込んでくるのを待ち呆けるとでも？　知的な夜に、粗暴なる貴方は似合わない。
`Did you think I'd be that senile, to just sit around here waiting for you to come barging in? You're way too inelegant for this intellectual night.

こんな間抜けに育てた親はどんな顔？
うん、見たよ、本当にそっくりな間抜け面。
I can only imagine what the parents who raised you to be such a moron must've looked like.

Oh right, I saw them, and they looked just as moronic as you.

今はお菓子の国でお腹いっぱい！”
Now, their bellies are full in the land of sweets!'

……あの魔女なら書きそうなことだ…。
...It was the sort of thing that witch would write...

……両親を失った子どもの誰かがここへ駆け込んでくるだろうことはお見通しだったというわけだ。
...It meant she'd predicted that one of the children who'd lost their parents would come running in here.

…もし、この部屋のどこかに隠れているのならば、今頃、腹を抱えて転げ回っているに違いない…。
...If she's hiding somewhere in this room, she must be rolling around laughing now...

あの魔女はそういうヤツ。
The witch was that kind of person.

…人の不幸を嘲笑い、千年の退屈しのぎをする…！
...She sneered at people's misfortune, using it to stave off the boredom of a thousand years...!

「これはお渡し下さい…！　お怪我をなさいますと申し上げております…！
"Hand it over...! I'm telling you you'll hurt yourself...!

………んんん、……んん！！」
......Nnnnng, ...nnnnggg!!"

「離せって言ってんだよ！！　くそおぉおおくそおおおッ！！
"I told you to let go!! Damn iiiiiit, damn iiiiiiit!!

……あぅッ！」
...Agh!"

郷田は、朱志香の振り回すインテリアスタンドを取り上げる。
…これ以上、振り回せば、どこかにぶつけて怪我をするかもしれないからだ。
Gohda snatched away the light stand Jessica had been holding.

...After all, if she kept swinging it around, she might end up smashing it against something, which could cause serious injury.

…郷田の目には、朱志香が怒りに狂い、憤怒の炎で己を焦がしているに違いないと映ったのだろう。
...To Gohda's eyes, Jessica probably looked mad with rage, burning herself up with the flames of anger.

……しかし、嘉音の目には違って見えた。
...But Kanon's eyes saw it differently.

それは多分、怒りに隠した、悲しみの涙…。
Those were probably...tears of sadness, hidden by rage...

だから。
インテリアスタンドを取り上げられた途端、朱志香が床に、まるで這いつくばるようにしながら、絨毯を掻き毟って泣き出した時。
So...

When the light stand was taken from Jessica, when she started crying on the floor, scratching at the carpet almost as though she was groveling...

……郷田は驚くが、嘉音は驚かなかった。
...Gohda was surprised, but Kanon was not.

……怒りを振り回すという泣き方を奪われたのだから、…それは必然なのだ。
...Of course. She had lost her means of crying by lashing out in rage.

「うううううぅううぅ、わああああああぁああぁあああああ！！　父さん……、母さん……、うわああぁああああああぁあぁぁうううぅ！！」
"Uuuuuuuuuuuuuu, waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!! Dad, ...Mom, ...uwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaauuuuuuuuu!!"

…それは、……右代宮本家の令嬢を思えば、…あまりにみすぼらしい姿。
……絨毯を爪で掻き毟り、足でもがくように掻く。
...Considering that she was a daughter of the Ushiromiya Head Family, ...she was in a very shabby state.

...She scratched at the carpet with her fingernails, and even her feet were scratching.

朱志香は強く強く、涙を流す。
…でないと、再び怒りが込み上げてきて、自分を飲み込んでしまいそうだから。
Jessica cried very, very hard.

...Because if she didn't, her rage would start building up again and swallow her up.

しかし、その度にあの便箋の屈辱のメッセージが蘇るのだ…。
But over and over again, she remembered that humiliating message...

……こんな間抜けに育てた親はどんな顔？
...I can only imagine what the parents who raised you to be such a moron must've looked like.

「間抜けなんかじゃないッ！！　父さんも母さんも、頭が良かった！！　私なんかとは違う、本当に頭が良かったッ！！　間抜けなんかじゃないぃ！　取り消せ、
"Don't you call them morons!! Both Dad and Mom were smart!! Unlike me, they were really smart!! Don't you call them morons! Take it back,




取り消せッ！！」
take it back!!"




うん、見たよ、本当にそっくりな間抜け面。
今はお菓子の国でお腹いっぱい！！
Oh right, I saw them, and they looked just as moronic as you.

Now, their bellies are full in the land of sweets!!

「うおおおぉおおおお、畜ッ生ォオオ！！！
"Aaaaaaaggghhh, damn iiiiiit!!

殺してやる殺してやる、野郎の腹を裂いて同じ目に遭わせてやるッ！！　ううわぁああああああぁああぁああ、わぁああああああぁああああああぁ……！！！　ぅっく、ゲホゲホ、ゴホンゴホンゴホンッ！！！」
I'll kill her I'll kill her, I'll slice open her stomach and see how she likes it!! Uuuuaaaaaaaaaaaa, waaaaaaaaaaaaaa...!!! Hic, *cough*cough*, *cough*cough*cough*!!!"

泣き喚く朱志香は、喘息の発作を起こしてしまう…。
見守っていた使用人たちは慌てて駆け寄り、その背中を撫でたが、それは朱志香の逆鱗に触れるだけだった…。
As Jessica cried and screamed, she triggered an asthma attack...

The servants watching over her hurriedly ran up to her and rubbed her back, but that only provoked Jessica's wrath...

「ゲホンゴホン！！　んだよッ！！　そんなことする暇があったら、あいつを探せよッ！！　探し出して私のところへ連れて来いッ！！
"*cough*cough*!! The hell?!! If you've got the time to do that, search for that bastard!! Find 'em and bring 'em here!!

お前らが行かないなら私が探す！！　そしてこの手で殺してやる、腹を引き裂いてやる！！
If you won't go, I will!! And I'll kill 'em with my own hands, I'll slice open her stomach!!

ゲホゲホゴホゴホ！！　がはッ、げはッ！！　触るんじゃねぇぜッ！！！　ちくしょぉ…、ちくしょぉ、ゲホゲホン！！
*cough*cough*cough*cough*!! *cough*, *cough*!! Don't touch me!!! Damn it, damn it, *cough*cough*!!

ゴホゲホンッ！！」
*cough*cough*!!"

朱志香はよろよろと立ち上がると、喘息を繰り返しながら廊下に出て行く…。
Jessica got up unsteadily, and as her asthma continued, she went out into the hallway...

「お嬢様、お薬を至急…！　南條先生をお呼びします！」
"Milady, your medicine, quickly...! I will call Doctor Nanjo!"

「……………郷田さん。………僕に、任せてくれませんか。」
"......Gohda-san, ......would you...leave this to me?"

嘉音は察した。
………歳が大きく離れた郷田には多分、…朱志香の心の涙が感じられない。
Kanon had noticed.

......Gohda, who was vastly separated from her in age, ...probably couldn't sense the tears in Jessica's heart.

……それを察した自分が、彼女を支えなければならないのだ。
...Kanon, who had noticed, had to be the one to support her.

「か、嘉音さん。…………いいのですか…？」
"K-Kanon-san, ......are you sure...?"

「………今のお嬢さんには、…涙を流す時間も必要なのだと思います。…………ご両親の、あんな死に方を目の当たりにしては…。」
"......I believe Milady needs some time to cry right now. ......Considering that she saw her parents killed like that..."

「………………………………。…そうですね。」
"...............You're right."

郷田も理解する。
Gohda also understood.

……そして、朱志香と嘉音の二人が、ささやかな交流を持っていることも知っていた。
だから、全てを理解し、任せる。
...And he knew that Jessica and Kanon had shared a vague relationship with each other.

So he understood everything...and left it to Kanon.

「………わかりました。……私は楼座さまのところへ戻ります。…お嬢様を、くれぐれもよろしくお願いしますよ。」
"......Very well. ...I will go back to Rosa-sama. ...Please, take care of Milady."

「はい。……お任せを。」
"Yes. ...Leave it to me."

嘉音は弱々しい声だったけれど、……力強く頷く。
その目を見て、郷田も同じように力強く頷いた。
Kanon's voice was frail, ...but he nodded firmly.

After looking at his eyes, Gohda nodded firmly as well.

…郷田も長い年季を持つベテランだ。
大勢の人間を見てきた。
...Gohda was a veteran with many years behind him.

He'd seen a great number of people in his life.

…だから、克己した人間の目に浮かぶ力強い輝きを知っていた。
...So he knew the vigorous sparkle that could be found in the eyes of those who possessed self-control.

それが嘉音の目に浮かんだのを確かに見た。
……だから、嘉音にこの場を任せるのだ。
He had surely seen that in Kanon's eyes.

...So, he would leave this to Kanon.

…思えば、郷田が嘉音に信頼して仕事を任せた、初めての瞬間だったかもしれない…。
...When you think about it, maybe this was the first time Gohda had ever trusted Kanon and relied on him for a job...

朱志香は喘息に苦しみながら、…壁にもたれかかりつつも、自分の部屋に向かっているようだった。
Jessica, still suffering from her asthma, ...seemed to be heading towards her room, though she kept leaning against the wall.

……嘉音は無言でその後を追う。
...Kanon followed her wordlessly.

手を貸せといわれれば、飛んでいって支える。
If she had asked for a hand, he would have leapt forward and supported her.

…しかし朱志香がそれを求めない限り気配を殺し、いつでも助けられる距離にいて、彼女を見守った。
...But until Jessica did ask for that, he chose to hide himself, watching over her from a distance where he could come to her rescue at any time.

……心が張り裂けそうなほど悲しい時、誰かがそこにいてくれたらと、百億の人々が振り返る時、居て欲しい場所に嘉音はいながら朱志香の背中を無言で見守った…。
...When people feel their hearts are about to explode from sadness and want to have someone by their sides, you can bet ten billion of them would want to turn around and find someone in the place Kanon now stood, as he watched over Jessica from behind...

そしてとうとう、自分の部屋の扉の前でうずくまってしまう。
Then, finally, she doubled over in front of the door to her room.

……喘息の発作は、全身の体力を奪う。
そして酸欠になった頭は朦朧とし、もはや立ち上がることもできないのだ。
...The asthma attack had stolen all her strength.

And her thoughts had gotten hazy from the lack of oxygen, making it impossible even to stand up again.

……でも、今の朱志香は誰かに手を貸されたいとは思っていない。
なぜなら、怒りの炎にまだ打ち勝てなかったから。
...But right then, Jessica didn't think she wanted someone to lend a hand.

She still hadn't been able to overcome the flames of anger.

…もし、差し伸べてくれる手が善意であっても、今の朱志香はその手を掴み引き裂いてしまいたくなるだろうから。
...Even if someone had offered her a hand with good intentions, Jessica would've wanted to tear it off right then.

…そしてそれがあまりに理不尽なことだと理解していたから。
…怒りの炎に打ち勝てるまで、彼女は決して助けを求めなかった。
...She knew how unfair that would be.

...So she definitely wouldn't ask for help until she overcame the fiery anger burning inside.

朱志香はもはや助けを口にする気力もなかったろう。
Jessica had probably lost the willpower even to call for help.

……でも、嘉音は聞いた。
…確かに聞いた。
...But Kanon heard it.

...He definitely heard it.

……世界中で悲哀に嘆く人々が、なぜこれほどに叫んでいるのに誰も聞こえてくれないのかと嘆くその声なき助けを、確かに嘉音は聞いた。
...Kanon definitely heard that voiceless call for help, one shared by miserable grievers the world round, ...an endless scream that no one ever seems to hear.

嘉音はそっと朱志香の脇に跪き、無言で肩を貸した。
Kanon quietly knelt by Jessica's side and wordlessly offered her a shoulder.

………自分の部屋の鍵を開け、入る…。

Jessica often said that when her asthma got serious enough, it hurt so bad that it felt like she'd vomit up her whole stomach.

顔色は蒼白で、目の焦点も定まっていなかった。
なのに咳だけはまだ繰り返している…。
Her face was pale, and her gaze wavered.

And yet, the coughing continued...

……それでも多分、…それよりも悲しみの方が勝っているのだ…。
...Even so, ...her sadness was probably even stronger...

ベッドに腰掛けさせると、嘉音はベッド脇のサイドテーブルの上にある可愛い篭の中から気管支拡張剤を取り、手渡した。
After having her sit on the bed, Kanon took a bronchodilator from a cute little basket on a nearby side table and handed it to her.

……朱志香は時折、薬を持ち歩くのを忘れる。
そんな気配のある時には、気を利かせて、使用人室の救急箱にある予備をこっそり持ち歩くのだが、今日はその準備がなかった。
...Jessica sometimes forgot to take her medicine with her.

Whenever this seemed to have happened, Kanon would take notice and secretly carry around the inhaler from the first-aid kit in the servant room, but he hadn't done so today.

……こんな日に持ち歩かなくて、どうして自分は家具などと言えるのかと自分を責めた。
...He scolded himself, as though wondering how he could call himself furniture after failing to bring it with him on a day like this.

………そして、それを口にし、朱志香の何かの気持ちを裏切った日を思い出して、…嘉音の心が軋んだが、……それは今の朱志香の悲しみに比べればはるかに不謹慎な感情だと思い、心の奥底に押し止める…。
......Then he remembered the day when he'd used that word and somehow betrayed Jessica's feelings. ...It jarred Kanon's heart, but he felt it would be indiscreet to think about something like that, considering how Jessica felt now, and he locked it up inside the depths of his heart...

「………はぁ、………はぁ…。……………………はぁ…。」
"......Haah, ......haah...............haah..."

薬を吸引すると、朱志香の荒い呼吸は少しずつ和らぎ、…ようやく落ち着きを取り戻す。
When she inhaled her medicine, Jessica's wild breathing calmed down bit by bit, ...and she was finally able to regain her composure.

………しかし、失った気力と体力は、彼女をベッドから起き上がらせるほどではなかった。
......But, she'd lost too much strength and willpower to get up from the bed.

「…………………大丈夫ですか。……お嬢様。」
".........Are you all right, ...Milady?"

「…………私は、
………大丈夫だぜ…。
"......I'm...

...all right...

………父さんと母さんは駄目だけど、
………私は、
……もうちょっと泣きゃ、
………大丈夫だぜ…………。」
......I'm all messed up over Mom and Dad,

......but...

after I cry a bit more...

...I'll be all right......"




「……………………。」
"........."

嘉音は失言を悔いる。
Kanon regretted his poor choice of words.

……今の彼女に、「大丈夫か」？
…何て自分は心の痛みを読めないのか。
…………だから、所詮は家具。
だから人間になれない…。
...Did he really say `Are you all right' to her?

...Was he really that clueless of the pain in her heart?

......This was what made him furniture.

This was why he couldn't become human...

「………………廊下におります。…御用がありましたら、すぐにお呼び下さい。」
".........I will be in the corridor. ...If you need anything, please call me immediately."

彼女には、ひとりで涙を流す時間がまだ必要であると嘉音は理解する。
嘉音はいつでも呼べと告げ、一礼してから退室しようとする。
Kanon understood that she still needed some time to cry alone.

He told her to call him at any time, bowed, and tried to leave the room.

「……ぁ、……………。」
"...Ah, ........."

「……何か。」
"...Do you need something?"

朱志香が呼び止めるような声を出したので、嘉音は足を止めた。
Jessica had spoken up as though she wanted him to stop, so Kanon had stopped.

………彼女が求めるならば、どんな助けにもなろうと思った。
…彼女の心の痛みが癒せるなら、今の僕は杖にも椅子にもなるだろう。
......If she asks it, I'll do anything I can to help her.

...Right now, I'd become even a cane or a chair if it would help ease the pain in her heart.

………そうすることで、……あの日に与えた心の痛みの代償となるのなら…。
......If by doing that, ...I could make up for the pain I dealt to her heart on that day...

「……………………………………。」
"............"

...It was as though her reason for stopping him was something she couldn't put into words.

「……………………………。」
"............"

「………………………。」

......Jessica broke that silence.

...With a small voice.

「………ごめん。………何でもないぜ。……………しばらくひとりになりたいって、楼座叔母さんに伝えてくれるかな…。」
"......I'm sorry. ......It's nothing. ......Could you tell Aunt Rosa that I want to be alone for a while...?"

"I won't...let you be alone."

............So, I will be in the corridor. ...Please call for me...

at any time."

For just an instant, it looked like some kind of hope had flitted into Jessica's eyes.

…でもそれはとても儚く、初雪が川面に消えるように、すっ…と消える。

嘉音は頭をもう一度下げ、扉を閉める…。

………彼女を勇気付けるため、言葉をかけたはずだった。
…………でも、なぜかそれは、かえって傷つけた気がした。

だから未だに、人の悲しみが、…汲み取れない。
That was why...he couldn't grasp human sadness even now.

………突き当たりの窓が、涼しげに自分を誘っている気がした。
As Kanon repeatedly questioned himself, he walked down the corridor.

......He felt like the window at the corridor's end was cooly calling to him.

「…………………………。……僕は、………やっぱり家具でしかないのか……。」
外は相変わらずの土砂降りで、薄暗い灰色の世界だった。

It was still pouring outside...a dark, gray world.

…今日のような天気の日にも、紗音はきっと海を見て青さを知るのだろう。
...Even on days like this, Shannon would surely see the ocean and know that it was blue.

……だが僕の目にはきっと、たとえ晴れていても灰色に見えている…。

海の青さがわからない限り、
……僕は人の形を似せた、家具でしかない………。

...I'll be nothing but furniture imitating a person......

「…………………本当に女心のわからぬヤツよ。
".........You really don't understand a woman's heart, do you?

...At times like that, you ought to silently remain by her side. ...*cackle*cackle* That's why you're furniture."

"......Y-You..."

この廊下に人の気配などあったはずもない。
冷たい空気に満たされた無人の廊下だった。
There shouldn't have been any trace of human life in this corridor.

It had been an empty corridor filled with frigid air.

………しかし嘉音の背中に、その嘲りの言葉は掛けられた。
......But those scoffing words approached Kanon from behind.

振り返れば、……そこにはあの魔女の姿があった。

When he turned around, ...he saw that witch.

That witch, who hadn't shown herself when Jessica had searched for her with a rage bordering on madness, and who had left that sneering letter to toy with Jessica...!

「女の傷付け方は３つある。…特別に妾が教えてやろう。１つは刃物で傷つける。１つは心で傷つける。
"There are three ways to hurt a woman. ...Let me teach you them. One is to hurt them with a blade. Another is to hurt them in their heart.

…そして最後が一番難しく、一番効果的に傷付けられる。なのに意識せずして傷付けられる。わかるか…？」
...The last way is the most difficult and most effective method of hurting them. And yet it can hurt them without you even realizing it. Do you know what I mean...?"

「わ、……わかるわけもないし、知りたくもないッ！！」
"...H-How could I know...? I don't even want to know!!"

「期待を裏切る、だ。
"It's to betray their expectations.

……女ほど夢見がちな生き物はいない！　勝手に夢を見、勝手に傷付く。……お前のような距離の男が一番女を傷付ける！　わかるまいな、貴様には。どれほど朱志香を傷付けてきたか、まったく考えが及んでいまい。」
...No living being is more of a dreamer than a woman! They make up dreams all on their own and end up hurting their own selves. ...A distant man like you hurts women the most! You couldn't understand. You have no idea how deeply you've wounded Jessica."

"I-I have no intention of playing along with your nonsense! ...Did you appear only to sneer at me?!!"

「自惚れるな家具。貴様如き、嘲笑うにも足りぬわ！
"Don't be so full of yourself, furniture. You aren't worth sneering at!

くっくっくっく！　しかしそなたもひとりではそれに値しなくても、二人揃えば充分に足りる。……若々しき男女の悲運を笑う喜びは何度繰り返しても飽きぬのでな。」
*cackle*cackle*! Still, though you may not be worth my time on your own, if the two of you are gathered, that's all I need. ...The pleasure that comes from laughing at the fates of young couples never tires me."

don't have that kind of relationship...! We can't become the sacrifices for the second twilight!"

「くっくっくくくくくはっははははははははははははははは！！　だからお前は朱志香を傷付ける。だからお前は人間になれぬッ…！！」
"*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha!! That's why you hurt Jessica. That's why you cannot become human...!!"

「ならば良いだろう、貴様が朱志香を想い人と認めぬならば、それを受け容れても良い。
"Then there should be no problem. If you won't admit you have feelings for Jessica, I can accept that.

……だが朱志香は殺す！！」
...But I will kill ~ib~her~ib~!!"

「この馬鹿がッ！！　決まっておろうがッ！！
"You idiot!! Isn't it obvious?!!

~ib~殺したらそなたが歪めるだろうその表情が楽しいからの他に何の理由が必要なのか~ib~ッ！！
~ib~It'll be fun to kill her and see your face twist in pain, why else~ib~?!!"

儀式に従い、妾は気まぐれに１３人を生贄とする。だが、それ以上を殺してはならないとの決まりはない。」
"Following the rules of the ceremony, 13 people will be sacrificed on my whims. However, there's no rule that says I can't kill more."

"...If it amuses me, I can kill any number of people!! So I will!!

~ib~Make me laugh as hard as I can~ib~, Kanonnnnnnnn the furrrrrrrrnituure!!"

その時、嘉音は確かに朱志香の悲鳴を聞いた。
At that time, Kanon definitely heard Jessica scream.

瞬きをして廊下の向こうを見た瞬間、直前まで当たり前のような顔をしてそこにいたはずの魔女の姿は掻き消えていた。
When he blinked and looked down the corridor, the witch who'd supposedly been there so nonchalantly just a second ago...was gone.

…自分は今この瞬間、たったひとりで廊下に立ち尽くしているに過ぎない。
...At that moment, he was just standing there all alone in the corridor, doing nothing.

……そして、守りたい人が助けを求めていて、その人は彼方にいる。
...And the person he wanted to protect was asking for help...from far away in that direction.

自分のすべきことは明白だった。
それは理屈じゃない。電気的で反射的。
一切の躊躇も雑念もない。
It was obvious what he should do.

It wasn't logical. It was an electric reflex.

Without a trace of hesitation or distraction.

…守りたい人がいて、助けを求めていて。
………だからその瞬間、そこにいるのが自分でありたいという純粋な気持ち。
...There was a person he wanted to protect, and she was asking for help.

......And, at that moment, he genuinely wanted the person by her side to be him.

朱志香の部屋に飛び込んだ時、その目に飛び込んできたのは異様な光景だった。
When he flew into Jessica's room, the scene that greeted his eyes was a bizarre one.

部屋は、金色の粉吹雪が舞い、まるでスノーグローブの中で金箔を舞い散らせているような幻想的な世界だった。
The room had become a fantastical world, where a blizzard of gold-colored specks danced, almost as though gold leaf had been scattered inside a snow globe.

………いや違う。
僕はこの光景を以前にも見ている。
これは金箔じゃない。
......No, that's not it.

I've seen this spectacle before.

This isn't gold leaf.

……無数の黄金の蝶たち、ベアトリーチェの眷属たちッ！！
...It's countless golden butterflies, Beatrice's minions!!

朱志香は無数の蝶に群がられ、必死にそれを払うように腕を振り回していた。
Jessica was surrounded by countless butterflies, waving her hands around, trying frantically to drive them away.

「お嬢様ッ！！！」

嘉音は朱志香に飛びつくと、群がる蝶たちを乱暴に払いのける。
Kanon rushed towards Jessica and violently brushed the cloud of butterflies away.

…この美しくも汚らわしい蝶たちは、朱志香の顔に群がり、口や鼻から入り込もうとしていたのだ。
...The butterflies, which were sickening despite their beauty, surrounded Jessica's face, trying to crawl in through her mouth and nose.

朱志香が激しく咽込む。
Jessica choked violently.

…まるで、この蝶たちが朱志香の喘息発作を引き起こし、嘲笑っているかのようだった。
...Almost as though the butterflies were triggering an asthma attack, mocking her.

だって、嘉音が駆けつけ朱志香が咽込んだら、蝶たちは襲うのをやめ、今度は二人の周りを優雅に、ロンドのように舞い始めたから。
But when Kanon ran towards her, the butterflies stopped attacking and began to dance an elegant rondo around the pair.

「………嘉音くん……、嘉音くん………。」

......Come out, Beatrice!! Are you happy now?!!"

苦しそうにしながら薬を吸引する朱志香を庇いつつ、嘉音は虚空に叫ぶ。
As he stood guard in front of Jessica, who was using her inhaler and seemed to be in pain, Kanon yelled into the empty air.

……すると確かに虚空は満足げに笑い返した。
...And when he did, the empty air did indeed laugh back, satisfied.

…そして姿を現す。
嘉音の要望に応えたわけじゃない。
...Then, she showed herself.

It wasn't in response to Kanon's demand.

姿を現して嘲笑った方が、より屈辱を与えられて楽しいからという理由でに決まってる！
It was obviously because appearing and sneering would bring them even more humiliation, and plus, it was more fun!

「くっくくくくくははははは！！　これで全ては筋書き通りよ。今やそなたは俎上の鯉よの。
"*cackle*cackle*cackle* Ahahahaha!! Now everything fits to the plot. Now, you're carp on the chopping board.

いや、二人が揃ったのだから鴨と葱と呼ぶべきか？　はっはははははははははははははは！！」
No, since we've got a pair of you, should I call it duck with green onions? Hahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha!!"

「お、……お前、
……ベ、ベアトリーチェ…！！」
"...Y-You,

...B-Beatrice...!!"

「お下がりください。
"Please, stand back.

……お嬢様は、僕が守る…！」
...I'll protect you, Milady...!"

"When the princess and knight come together, it's inevitable that the witch will appear. ...Yes, why don't you show me how much power Kinzo's furniture can muster?"

魔女は指を弾いて鋭い音を立てる。
She snapped her fingers with a piercing sound.

すると部屋に黄金の蝶たちの吹雪が起こり、それらは渦を巻きながら小山を作っていく。
When she did, a blizzard of gold butterflies was stirred up, and they began to form a small mountain as they whirled around in a circle.

…まるで、木枯らしが渦を巻いて枯葉の山を作るように。
...It was just like the swirling of a cold, wintry wind that builds up a mountain of leaves.

その黄金の小山から、腕が生え、…まるで、底の世界の住民が這い上がってくるかのように、……現れる。
From that mound of gold, a hand sprouted...and ~ib~it~ib~ appeared, ...as though a resident of the world below was crawling up from beneath the ground.

「な、………何これ……。何だよこれ……ッ？！」
"...Wh-What is this...? What the hell is this...?!"

朱志香は今見ているものが何なのか、理解できず、口をぱくぱくとさせる…。
それはまさに、理解不能なものをわかろうとする知の咀嚼。
Jessica couldn't comprehend what she was seeing right now, and her mouth kept flapping open and closed...

It was the bite of wisdom, seen in those trying to understand something incomprehensible.

這い上がりし者は、……多分、魔女に仕える従者に違いないだろう。
その身なりは、仕える者たちが身にまとう様式に則る正装に見えた。
That thing crawling up...was probably an attendant who served the witch.

It appeared to be wearing a uniform suitable for one who served.

……しかし顔が違う。それは、異形…。
……真っ黒な毛に覆われ、…腐った息を吐き、溶岩と同じ地の底の怪しい輝きを湛える目。
...But its face was...wrong. It looked...strange...

...It was covered with pitch-black hair, ...breathed rotten breath, and its eyes were filled with the same strange subterranean glow as lava.

…そして、………人ならざる者の象徴である、…二本の角…。魔女に仕える山羊面の従者の姿だった……。
...And, ......to symbolize its nonhuman status, ...it had two horns... It was the figure of a goat-faced attendant who served the witch...

「………………………ッッ！！！」
"............!!!"

朱志香はもう、自分が口に出すべき言葉すら決め切れない。
By now, Jessica had no idea what she should say.

…目の前で起こっている、この世の常識で説明できないそれに、ひたすら口をぱくぱくさせるだけだった。
...All this happening in front of her couldn't be explained with common sense, and she couldn't do anything except open and close her mouth.

……朱志香は気付けなかった。
…この島がすでに、この世の法則から切り離されていることに。
...Jessica hadn't realized.

...She hadn't realized that this island had already been cut off from the rules of our world.

しかしそれでも理解はできる。
……この山羊の従者が魔女の使いで、……自分の命を狙っていることは。
But there were some things even she could understand...

...This goat attendant served the witch...and was after her life.

そして魔女もそれをすでに命じてあるらしい。
そして嘉音に期待の眼差しを向ける。
And apparently, the witch had already given it the order.

She was looking at Kanon with an expectant gaze.

……どのようにして姫君を守るつもりなのかと、期待という名の挑発の眼差しを向ける！
...She looked at him with an expectant and therefore challenging gaze, as though asking him how he intended to protect this maiden!

従者は、這い上がる時こそ獣のように見えたが、それの背筋は美しく、黄金の魔女に仕えるに値する気品を充分に備えているように見えた。
Though the attendant had looked especially bestial while crawling to its feet, you could see in the way it carried itself that it possessed more than enough grace to be worthy of serving the Golden Witch.

……そして、仕える主の期待に応えたいという家具の喜びに満ち溢れていることもわかる。
...And you could tell that it was overflowing with the joy of furniture wanting to meet its master's expectations.

「………見せてもらおうではないか。金蔵の家具の力を！
"......Well then, why don't you show me? Let's see the power of Kinzo's furniture!

今度は間違えるな？　……家具であることを忘れるな？　この期に及んで人間のフリを続けるのなら、死ぬのはお前だけでは済まぬぞ。くっきっきききききききききききき！」
This time, don't get the wrong idea, okay? ...Don't forget that you're furniture, got it? If you try to continue playing the human even now, this won't be settled by your death alone. Hihihihihihihihihihihihihihihi!"

山羊の従者は黙礼するような仕草をする。
それは、主に応えるためのものだったのか、対峙する嘉音に捧げたものなのか、…わからない。
The goat attendant made what seemed to be a silent, respectful bow.

Was it directed at its master, ...or was it offered to Kanon, its opponent?

そして、従者の手に、……邪まなる、悪意の刃が現れる……。
Then, on the attendant's hand, ...a blade of wicked malice appeared...

「………な、
…………何だよ、
………ソレ…………。」
"......Wh-

What the hell...

...is that......?"




朱志香にはすでにとっくに、目の前で起こっていることなど理解できない。
Jessica had been unable to understand what was happening before her eyes for a while now.

……理解に及ぶのは、……ソレが自分の命を脅かすために閃いているということだけだ。
そして、今はそれで充分だった。
...All she understood...was that this glow in front of her existed for the purpose of ending her life.

And right now, that was enough.

嘉音の背中に隠れる朱志香に、嘉音は静かに言う。
Kanon spoke quietly to Jessica, who was hiding behind his back.

「………お嬢様。…壁に下がっていて下さい。…背中は決して壁から離さないように。」
"...Milady, ...please stay back against the wall. ...Never let your back leave the wall."

"Wha...?!"

「……くっくっくっくっくっく！　姫君は大人しく騎士殿の背中に隠れているがいい。自らの命を男に守らせる醍醐味でも存分に味わえば良い。
"...*cackle*cackle*cackle*! It's only right for the maiden to obediently hide behind the great knight's back. I do hope you enjoy the pleasure of having your life protected by a man.

……さぁ！　嘉音、お前の刃を見せてみよッ！！」
...Now! Kanon, let's have a look at your blade!!"

"...Beautiful.

…金蔵は家具を生み出すことに関してだけは、妾の足元に及ぶやも知れぬ。」

「…こんなもの、薔薇の手入れにも、……使えない。」

".........K-Kanon-kun, .........what's......"

"So, you've taken it out. ......How does it feel to expose your subhumanity in front of the girl you care for?"

".........Be silent."

「……ふ。……憤怒で己を焦がしているくせに冷静を装うか。…なるほど、真に熱き炎は青く静かだという。今のそなたがそうだというのか。」
"...Hmph. ...So, you'll act composed, even though you're really burning with wrath? ...Yes, they do say that truly hot flames burn a cool blue. Is that how you are now?"

「僕の力で、お前を殺すことなどできるわけもない。……お前は月。石つぶてを投げたとて月を砕くことなどできるわけもない。……だが、お前は顕現するために水面にその姿を映す。」
"There's no way I can kill you with my power. ...You are the moon. I could never smash the moon by throwing a rock. ...However, in order to manifest yourself, you've had to reflect your image off the surface of the water."

水面に石つぶてを投じれば、一時、月を乱すこともできるかもしれない。
…しかし、月を砕くことなど至らない。
If you throw a rock at the surface of the water, you might be able to disturb the moon's image for some time.

...But that doesn't mean the moon has been smashed.

「だから僕は。
"So.

……この命尽きるまで、
……お前の映る水面を叩き続けてやる……！」
...Until this life of mine is over,

...I'll keep on striking your reflection...!"

「気に入ったぞ、嘉音ッ！！　始めろ、家具どもッ！！」
"I like it, Kanon!! Begin, furniture!!"

「…………ほぉ。……………美しい軌跡だ。」
"......Hoh. .........What a beautiful curve."

魔女が漏らす感嘆の言葉が、沈黙を解き、朱志香の金縛りを一瞬だけ解く。
The witch's words of admiration broke the silence, and for just an instant, they broke Jessica's paralysis.

「…………………………、
わ、
……私は、

"............

A

-Am I...

dreaming......?"




「…………来い。魔女の家具め。………元来た地獄へ叩き落してやる。」
"......Come, furniture of the witch. ......I'll beat you down to the hell you came from."

「………………………………。」
"............"

嘉音の頬に一条の赤い筋が残る。
…それを見て魔女はにやりと笑う…。
A strand of red had been left on Kanon's cheek.

...The witch saw this and grinned broadly...

「くっくくくくくくくくく。……勘が戻らぬことを、言い訳に呟いても良いぞ？」
"*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle* ...Feel free to mutter excuses about how your instincts still haven't returned quite yet."

山羊の従者の刃が描く軌跡は、……大きな弧を虚空に描く。
The curve drawn by the goat attendant's blade...drew a large arc in empty space.

…嘉音の姿は、そこにない。
...Kanon...wasn't there.

輝く軌跡が描くその戦いがチェスだったなら。
…それは背後より掛けた嘉音のチェック。
If this battle of drawing sparkling curves was chess...

...Then Kanon coming from behind was check.

詰める、詰める、詰める、詰める。
七手を掛けて、メイトする…！
And press, and press, and press, and press.

Use seven moves, and make it mate...!

……山羊の従者には断末魔を発する資格も与えられていなかったのか。
...Perhaps the goat attendant hadn't even been granted the ability to go into death throes.

……それは膝を落として倒れながら、ぶわっと黄金の蝶たちの群に崩れ散っていく…。
...As its knees buckled and it fell over, it broke into a bunch of gold butterflies with a pop...

だから、床に倒れる音はなかった。
この戦いを理解できぬ者にも、…嘉音が華麗であったことだけはきっと理解できた。
So there was no sound of it hitting the ground.

Even those unable to understand this battle...would surely realize that Kanon had been magnificent.

「……ふ。ハンドメイドには勝てぬか。…そこまで見下げたものではないらしい。」
"...Hmph. So, it couldn't win against a handmade piece. ...It seems you aren't quite that pathetic."

"You're next, ......Beatriiiiiiiiiiiiiiice!!"

嘉音の刃は、まるで溶けかかったバターを切るように、魔女の姿を斜めに切断した刹那、その姿は黄金色に弾け散る。
The instant Kanon's blade sliced diagonally through the witch's form like a knife through butter, she turned gold and burst.

……何千という黄金の蝶たちが散らばって、室内を一瞬だけ黄昏色の光で満たす。
...She scattered into several thousand gold butterflies, and for just an instant, the room was filled with the color of twilight.

…嘉音が自ら口にした通りなのだ。
ベアトリーチェに斬りつけようとも、水面に映る月を斬るに同じこと。
...It was just as Kanon himself had said.

Slicing Beatrice was just the same as slicing the surface of the water where the moon was reflected.

…魔女の姿は、さっきからずっとそこにいたかのような当り前の表情を浮かべつつ、嘉音の後にあった。
...The witch's form, with an ordinary expression on its face, as though she'd been there the whole time, ...was right behind Kanon.

「はっはっはっはっはっはっは…！！　充分に面白い見世物であったぞ。それに免じ、見逃してやろうかと思ったが、今の無礼で気が変わった…。」
"Hahahahahahaha...!! You've provided quite an entertaining show. Out of respect for that, I thought about letting you off the hook, but your rudeness now has made me change my mind..."

喋るな、家具が。無口であれ、家具が。身の程を知れ、家具がッ！！」
Do not speak, furniture. Be silent, furniture. Know your place, furniture!!"

"...K-Kanon-kun isn't furniture...!"

"I don't need a reason. ...Kanon-kun is Kanon-kun.

うぅん、本当の名前は別にあるけれど、……それでも名前は家具じゃないッ！　嘉音くんには嘉音くんの生き方がある。それはとても高潔なもので、自らが決めるもの。」
No, his real name's different, ...but a name doesn't make him furniture! Kanon-kun has his own way of living. That's a noble thing, and it's something he gets to decide for himself."
